dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We open on BETHESDA FOUNTAIN in the heart of New York’s Central Park, then we pull up and away, hurtling backward over the city until we come to rest in TIMES SQUARE, whic has been blocked off for an EPIC STREET RACE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge crowds line the street, cheering on TWENTY EXOTIC VEHICLES waiting at the starting line. A MOTORBIKE straight from Road Warrior idles on the outsi lane. Most of the other racers are in STOCK CARS, every driver wearing the same helmet. These are SIXERS, we’ll get back to them later. Interspersed with the Sixers are vehicles of every variet And when I say every variety I mean that some of them are cars, and some of them are hover craft, and one of them i BLIMP with a jet engine on it. Their drivers are every size, shape and color, too. They called GUNTERS. That too will be on the quiz. The closer we get to the West Side of 7th Avenue, the mor Gunters there are. The second to last car is probably the most bad-ass of the lot, a replica of DECKARD’S SPINNER f BLADE RUNNER. AECH, a handsome guy with the shoulders of a linebacker, checks the OVERSIZED ENGINE strapped to the roof.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Lemme guess - Mario Kart? He turns to see PARZIVAL, standing beside his vintage DELOREAN, literally the car from BACK TO THE FUTURE. He’s nineteen years old, good-looking and fit.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: No. Designed it myself, actually. Bad ass, right?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: It’s very Nintendo. Their friendly rivalry requires busting on each other constantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than your p.o.s. level 4 skin over a level 1 frame.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Weird that I’m still gonna outrace you. What does that say?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: It says you’re delusional, Z. I’m in the two spot. No way you get farther.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Let’s see who makes it past 57th. A SIREN signals the drivers to get in their cars. Parziva makes a fist, Aech returns the salute.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First to the key.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: First to the egg. And they get in their cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUNSHOT starts the race and the cars roar onto Seventh Avenue. Almost immediately, an Eighteen Wheeler runs a re light and A THIRD OF THE CARS RAM RIGHT INTO IT. And they literally explode. Just like that. Boom, half th cars are incinerated. Nobody bats an eye or stops cheerin

dialogues.speaker: IN THE DELOREAN
dialogues.text: Parzival stomps on the accelerator, chasing Aech's dust. bump and jockey for position, but Parzival is careful to avoid all of them, steering with tremendous precision.

dialogues.speaker: ON 44TH STREET
dialogues.text: Metal walls suddenly pop up from the street, incongruousl and with pretty much no logic to their placement. More of Sixer vehicles CRASH or SPIN OUT. Aech has already passed them, and Parzival simply veers through the debris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dumbasses. You don’t start from the outside lanes. He catches up with Aech, and, as they HANG a LEFT on 45th street, he cuts past him on the inside. Parzival’s winning. For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival hangs a RIGHT on 8th Avenue and puts the pedal t the floor. On every block, a different obstacle emerges, each time another driver is taken out. SINKHOLES open at street, a MANIAC WITH A FLAMETHROWER sprays the intersect at 50th street, and at 54th street... A T-REX stomps out into the street and Parzival nimbly swerves between its legs, just as its massive jaws POP TH BLIMP. It’s not your typical street race. EXT. 57TH STREET —- CONTINUOUS Parzival turns right at 57th to get back over to Seventh Avenue, and now AECH suddenly BOMBS OUT OF NOWHERE and PA HIM. He flips Parzival the bird as he makes a left back onto seventh. Parzival settles in behind him. Up ahead, a few blocks away, is CENTRAL PARK. But before that is 58th street. The whole block is in an exaggerated state of construction, like an obstacle cours leading up to A COLLAPSING CRANE. It’s all a matter of timing and angle to get past the collapsing crane, and Aech tries to take it AS SHARP AND FAST as he can. He clears the falling CRANE, but he’s going too fast. He SKIDS OUT, and his car FLIPS OVER. A MOMENT LATER, Parzival DRIFTS PAST HIM, going just a bi slower. His DeLorean SKIDS, but he makes the turn.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: HALF A MILE AHEAD --
dialogues.text: A CEMENT TRUCK is backing up, narrowing the space Parziv can drive through. He GUNS THE ENGINE, trying to get over fast enough to get past the TRUCK before it seals him off But he’s too late. The DeLorean SLAMS into the truck, whi EXPLODES WITH WET CEMENT. AECH APPROACHES the smoking, cement-covered DeLorean, as Parzival climbs out through its dented gull-wing doors.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Really thought I was gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I’m telling you, it’s rigged.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Dude, don’t go there.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: No other explanation. Their conversation is interrupted by the ROAR OF AN ENGIN They turn to see the ROAD WARRIOR MOTORBIKE ZOOM PAST THE seemingly headed straight for the truck, which now has th street completely blocked off.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This should be ugly. The MOTORBIKE suddenly veers off the street and INTO THE CONSTRUCTION ZONE. It plows over cones, then hits a stret of BROKEN SIDEWALK, one piece angled UP, and RAMPS OFF IT

dialogues.speaker: JUMPING THE TRUCK
dialogues.text: Aech and Parzival exchange a glance, then chase after the motorbike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE ROAD WARRIOR BIKE speeds towards camera, fifty yards from the park entrance. The driver is stoic, completely focused, absolutely determined to make it, and that’s whe A METEOR (yes, I’m serious, a meteor) plunges from the sk and slams into the street. The RIDER has to BAIL OUT as t BIKE slams into the smoking rock and EXPLODES.  EXT. CENTRAL PARK —- CONTINUOUS Parzival and Aech run up to the wreckage. The RIDER emerg from the smoke, whipping off her helmet, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: A meteor?! Seriously? Aech and Parzival gape at a woman in her early twenties; raven hair, big hazel eyes, rounded cheekbones and a perpetual smirk. She HURLS HER HELMET at the Meteor. It too explodes.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: You almost made the park, you realize how huge that is?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Do I have the key? No. Not huge.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: (star struck) Hey. You’re Artemis!

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. She walks past them. Parzival, staring, has lost whatever sense of cool he seemed to possess.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I love you. I mean... we love you.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: (interrupting) What he means is, we’re big fans. We've read your stuff, seen your channel...

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: You should come with us!

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: (to Aech) He always like this?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: No. (to Z, under his breath) Dude, act like you’ve met a girl before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just mean... to talk about Halliday, and the Egg. And the race.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: You guys are gunters? I mean, serious, not just jerking off on the weekend...?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Not jerking off on weekends at all.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: My socially inept friend here was the first to 49th, first to 55th...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wait a minute... you’re Parzival.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I know. Artemis smiles, touche. She turns to Aech.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: So where is your place anyway? INT. AECH’S BASEMENT - OASIS A suburban rec room, circa the early 1980's. Movie and co book posters cover the wood-paneled walls. A vintage RCA television is hooked up to a Betamax, a LaserDisc player, several vintage videogame consoles, most prominently an A 2600.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wow. Aech leads Artemis in, Parzival right behind.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Show her the workshop. Aech, ahead of him, kicks open the door to what should be closet...

dialogues.speaker: AN ENORMOUS WORKSHOP/GARAGE
dialogues.text: Completely out of proportion to the room, Aech's garage i enormous space filled with exotic vehicles, including replicas of the BATMOBILE, PEE WEE’S BICYCLE, and most impressively...  An unfinished replica of a familiar GIANT ROBOT.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Is that...

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: The Iron Giant? Yeah, just got the commission for it. No big deal. Artemis checks out the surface of the enormous, stylized robot. The unfinished parts of it are still a 3D grid.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Aech’s work is top rated on the modboards.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: (shrugging) It’s mostly about getting the right skins, what you can license, you know? Like Matrix, Matrix kids, forget it, but Star Wars, Marvel, Dark Knight, the classic Ridley Scotts...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Golden Age Spielberg?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Pre-Jurassic is a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Always wanted the Mothership from Close Encounters.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Yeah, tough to find.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Tough to park. Artemis laughs. Parzival lights up.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Never thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, handling is an issue. I mean you can’t build a Giant Robot and have it ride like a Buick Regal.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Buick... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shitty car from Halliday’s time.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Right. Aech pulls the door shut. Music comes up... TEMPTATION, b NEW ORDER, the original Factus 8 version, not the remix.. INT. AECH’S BASEMENT Artemis bops around the room checking the place out. She comes to THE HALLIDAY WALL, which is loaded with memorabi (And no, we don’t know who he is yet, but we’re getting there.)

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Whoa, great collection here. Most prominently, the classic magazine cover from JANUARY 2040, the day Halliday died. It’s the photo of him in fad jeans and a vintage Space Invaders T-shirt, the headline JAMES HALLIDAY, 1972-2040.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: So you're checking my private Gunter stash - where's the quid pro quo? (off her look) The jump. Artemis debates whether or not to tell them.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: The sidewalk is cracked. Had to be a reason, there always is with Halliday.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Exactly. That’s what I’ve been saying.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Please, not the “theory” again...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: “Theory”?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: The challenge is unwinnable. It’s designed to drive us nuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halliday wouldn’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Maybe he just made a mistake? I mean, there was no one to bug test it.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: No way, he never made mistakes.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Well... not totally true. They both turn to look at him.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He once screwed up a level of Flunkie Sprat Three.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wow, that is some seriously deep cut triv, Z. I gotta admit, you are as hardcore a Halliday nerd as anyone I’ve ever met. Parzival blushes a bit. Aech notices this.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: We’re gunters. “First to the key...”

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: “,.. first to the egg.” She looks from Parzival to Aech, sizing them up.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: So how come you guys aren't ina clan? Parzival shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Thank you, I’ve told him a million times we'd be better off working together. But Z thinks the only way someone wins is solo.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Tell that to IOI and the Sixers.  10.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: (quickly) They won't win. Halliday won’t let them.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: He’s dead, dude.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: The Oasis was his baby. He wouldn’t set it up for some corporate borg- spawn.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: (aside, to Artemis) He gets a little touchy about the whole Halliday thing, thinks they have some sort of bond.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: No, that’s not... I just think I understand the guy, maybe because...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Parzival is interrupted by a disembodied voice that echoe out over the room, though only he seems to hear it.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Because why?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wade! Have you seen my gloves?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Oh, crap. Artemis looks at him quizzically.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Sorry, it was awesome meeting you. Gotta split. And with that, PARZIVAL SUDDENLY DISAPPEARS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now we see WADE WATTS, the “real” Parzival, in the re world.  11. He’s inside an 80’s vintage van with fogged over windows, wearing a HAPTIC VISOR, which he quickly pulls off. “Parzival” is an idealized version of Wade, in reality he shy and gangly, sporting worn corduroys and a baggy sweat And a pair of I0I-branded HAPTIC GLOVES.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: They’re not on my desk. Where they should be. The conversation with his Aunt switches from the visor to mobile headset the size of a dime on his earlobe. Wade tucks the gloves into a backpack and scrambles out o the van, pushing past boxes of busted laptops, computer p and old car batteries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VAN is buried under other junked vehicles, arranged perfectly so it’s hidden from the outside world. Wade loc the door behind him, keeping the conversation going.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Why would I take your gloves?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Because you spend every waking moment in the Oasis and you don’t have your own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade emerges from the mound of old cars into an empty playground. He checks to make sure no one saw him come ou his secret hideout, then keeps moving.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Where are you, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I’m out with some friends.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You don’t have any friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade has now arrived at his destination: THE STACKS.  12. Dozens of MOBILE HOMES stacked on top of each other, connected by a makeshift network of recycled pipes, girde and support beams. There are a dozen Stacks in all, the future’s version of suburban tract housing.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I actually just met someone I really like.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: A real person?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Funny. The lower trailers -- and other empty wall spaces -- are punctuated with the occasional bit of political graffiti. Most of the references are to “IOI”, an organization that seems particularly unpopular with people who like writing slogans on walls. As he runs through the streets, he passes two kids wearin “REB” t-shirts; a picture of a leader called “JC3” in the same vein as Che Guevara. They take potshots at overhead DELIVERY DRONES with air rifles. They wing one of the drones which sputters and falls, alm hitting a stray dog. Wade MUTES his headset for a moment as he hustles past th

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the hell, guys?

dialogues.speaker: REB
dialogues.text: IOI, brah. Gotta stop ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: By shooting someone’s tube socks out of the sky?

dialogues.speaker: REB
dialogues.text: Stuff it in your suckchute, loser.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (to himself) Suckchute, that's new.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Still need my gloves, Wade. Wade jumps up and grabs on to the skeletal metal structur that keeps the whole stack in place. He starts CLIMBING.  13. EXT. WADE’S STACK - NIGHT We follow Wade as he scrambles up the outside of the stac The climb grows increasingly perilous as he goes. Physica Wade’s no specimen, but this is one thing in the real wor that he is actually good at.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Just remembered where they are. He finally reaches his unit. He peers through the BATHROO WINDOW, then climbs through it. INT. WADE’S HOME - BATHROOM - NIGHT In the pitch dark bathroom, Wade cracks the door and can see his AUNT ALICE, 30’s and haggard in a meth-y kind of standing in the living room.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: They’re in the kitchen. On top of the fridge. Alice turns to look at the kitchen, AWAY from Wade. When starts to walk in that direction, Wade makes his move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade dashes into the messy, cramped living room. He quick stashes the gloves under the COUCH CUSHIONS, then walks a quietly as he can to the front door. Alice, annoyed, paces back into the living room...

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (INTO HEADSET)
dialogues.text: I can’t be late again. ++. just as Wade walks IN through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: They're right there, Alice. He points to the gloves, sticking out from under the couc cushions.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See? I didn’t have em. Alice, slightly chastened, takes the gloves from him, the settles into a recliner.  14.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That is bull pucky, amigo. A FLUSH from the bathroom as RICK, Alice’s white trash boyfriend, walks into the living room. Wade grimaces, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You were in there when...

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Fell asleep, it was a long one. (to Alice) This lying bastard had the gloves. Rick continues past them and into the kitchen. Alice glar at Wade.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Damnit Wade, bad enough you don’t have a job without screwing up mine. Now you can’t use ‘em at all.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What? But I... Alice waves him away, slipping on her IOI gear. She speak into her official IOI headset and waves her hands awkward

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (INTO HEADSET)
dialogues.text: (monotone) This way, please... Wade glares at Rick, now tugging on a beer. Rick shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade enters the tiny slice of the unit he calls his room. Outside his window, like a cruel taunt, is a giant billbo advertising a SHAPTIC@ BRAND HAPTIC BOOTSUIT, a totally badass immersion rig for logging in to the Oasis. The BILLBOARD advertisement reads “Log In!” and features muscular guy modeling a suit that promises “Total Interfa and “Real-time Neuromuscular Response!” Hold on Wade, staring up at that ad.  15. INT. WADE’S HOUSE - THE NEXT DAY (REAL WORLD) Wade wakes up, wipes the sleep from his eyes. It might be from spending too much time in the Oasis, but there’s a moment of hopefulness, like maybe he’s someplace awesome. But nope, same crappy apartment, same billboard taunting INT. WADE’S HOUSE - MORNING Wade pours himself a bowl of cereal and milk water (milk- flavored water). From the kitchen table, through an open door, Wade can see into his aunt’s bedroom. Alice is passed out from a long night of work, Rick lies asleep on top of her, drooling. Wade cringes. CLOSE ON -- the HAPTIC GLOVES and VISOR sitting on Alice’ desk. They’re YANKED out of frame --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in his hideout, Wade slips his VISOR on, then logs i He sees the last three words anyone sees before leaving t real world for the Oasis:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INCIPIO, the MAIN PLANET of the Oasis, is a giant city fi with every building or structure, real or fictional, you possibly imagine.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When Halliday first built the Oasis, it was an open-world, massively-multiplayer online game. Over time it grew into way more than that. Parzival suddenly appears, mid stride. He passes the Eiff Tower next to the Taj Mahal, with EXXON/WHOLEFOODS corpor headquarters jammed between them.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: One of his biggest ideas was tying your avatar into your DNA, using their proprietary software. One account per person, no exceptions. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Everyone started equal in the Oasis. And it was free. Parzival opens his HUD, his “heads up display” which appe as a seamless interface with the world around him. He has gamer attributes -- SPEED, STRENGTH, MAGIC, AIM -- and an INVENTORY for weapons, spells, and vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Your avatar was fully upgradeable, but that took experience. And money. The DELOREAN is in there, currently marked “damaged”. The price to fix it is 5,000 gold coins. His account has a balance of 4,560.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: (using a voice command) Locate Aech. An image of AECH comes up; like the graphics over any spo broadcast, his avatar moves and poses and winks. “LOCATING...” appears. Wade continues on his way, passing through what looks lik the heart of the city. Off to his right is the main GREGARIOUS GAMES headquarters, a gleaming, castle-like to

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Once the Oasis took off, Halliday'’s partner Ogden Morrow got pushed out. Since Halliday died, no one knew exactly who ran the Oasis anymore. But a good guess? Just down the block from Gregarious is IOI HEADQUARTERS, massive, corporate monstrosity.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: IOI, Innovative Online Industries. They build the haptic gear. The gloves, the visors... INT. WADE’S HIDEOUT - THE REAL WORLD Wade lies in his haptic rig, a series of quick cuts of TH IOI LOGO, on Wade’s gloves, visor, the boots... IOI has t name on everything.  17.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in Incipio...

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Which means they control most people’s access to the Oasis. Parzival checks his HUD, Aech is still being “located”.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Halliday kept IOI in line. But now? Well if you asked the rebels, IOI’s plan was to turn the Oasis into a hellish place where rules were numerous and always followed.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: S'up, Z? AECH now appears in a window in a close-up, clearly real footage. Wherever he is it’s loud and dusty, and bursts o smoke and gunfire make it difficult to see and hear.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: What the hell are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I'm trying to win the musket of infinite velocity.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But people loved the Oasis ‘cause it was free. At least in spirit, you could do anything. The camera suddenly TAKES OFF, shooting away from Parziva

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And into OUTER SPACE.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Halliday built an entire universe, something for everyone... We SHOOT ACROSS THE GALAXY, passing countless planets... One of them seems to be a huge SPACECRAFT, IMPOSSIBLY LAR But as we pass it we see that it is the LETTER “S"”, floa in space. The rest of the word is so big we can’t make it from this perspective.  18.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Which is how you end up with a place like Planet Doom. We approach a planet that seems to have beautiful and elaborate weather systems swirling around it. As we get closer, we realize that the “weather” is actually EXPLOSI from a never-ending war.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The first gamers in the Oasis walked around blowing each other away right in front of everyone else. Halliday realized he needed to draw some boundaries. He divided the Oasis into combat zones, or PVP, and non-combat zones. As we descend from the atmosphere, we pass over “The Dark Side” of Planet Doom, which is sealed off from the war zo by a giant wall known as Anorak’s Fence.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He migrated all the most violent first person shooters to one planet. One giant PVP zone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We swoop in from the atmosphere to reveal a perfectly rendered vision of the battle of Appomattox, with some sm changes.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Who you up against? Mixed in with the soldiers are a bunch of avatars that ar way out of context.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: The South. But also Aliens. And the Roman Legion, I think. Aech is on the Union side, a musket with one hand, and a futuristic BLASTER in the other.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Think I might’ve figured something out. Wanna swing by the journals and take another run at the key?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Wish I could.  19. As he moves across the field, Aech shoots an Alien with h musket, then a Confederate soldier with his blaster. As t explode, their COINS shower to the ground. A VACUUM TUBE Aech’s shoulder sucks them right into his inventory.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This sesh has got another five hours, minimum. DAMNIT! Aech just got winged in the ribs by an enchanted ARROW.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Aech was my best friend in the Oasis, probably my best friend period, even though I'd never met him. Aech launches himself into the fray, racking up kills.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He also had a lot of stuff, including a dope spaceship. So I was always hitting him up for rides.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aech’s window disappears, so Parzival toggles his HUD to navigation.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: (voice command) Memoir-opolis. A pathway suddenly lights up in front of him, showing him path to take.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Oasis was like the real world in that respect; the more money you had, the more stuff you got, and the more stuff, the easier it was to get around, and thus get even more stuff. Wade heads towards a train station. The train tracks head AND OFF THE PLANET.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I think that’s why Halliday’s challenge was such a big deal. It wasn’t just the money. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: For someone like me, it was the chance to go from peasant to king in a heartbeat. Wade takes a seat on a bench at the train station, waitin for his ride.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Like everyone else, I remember exactly where I was the day the contest was announced... the day James Halliday died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A giant, virtual classroom. PARZIVAL is one of a thousand avatars sitting and listening to a virtual ALBERT EINSTEI teach them rudimentary science. Suddenly, everyone in the room gets an alert... JAMES HALLIDAY, DEAD AT 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE, 13 years old, rips his early-iteration headset off. eyes fill with tears. He is in his cozy childhood home. There are boxes everywh the family has just moved in. In the background, his FATH paints the living room wall while his MOTHER cooks dinner When she sees her boy crying, she runs over to comfort hi Despite the tragedy, clearly these were happier times for Wade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At a funeral parlor, people dressed in black mourn before open casket... The body inside is JAMES HALLIDAY, shiny quarters cover e of his eyelids.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But it wasn’t his death that changed everything. It was his will.  21. IN THE CASKET -- Halliday’s avatar suddenly SITS UPRIGHT begins talking to camera.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: Hello. I’m James Halliday. If you're watching this, I’m dead. He snaps his fingers and a SCROLL appears in his hand. He unfurls it to the floor and begins reading aloud...

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I, James Donovan Halliday, do hereby declare this to be my last will and testament... A CAPTION at the bottom of the screen reads: “Halliday's Announcement" (archival footage property of GGS) INT. ANORAK’S CASTLE (OASIS) Now Halliday appears inside a castle as ANORAK, his avata tall, robed wizard with a slightly more handsome version Halliday's face.

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK
dialogues.text: Before I died, I created my own Easter egg, and hid it somewhere inside the OASIS. The first person to find the egg will inherit my entire fortune and earn complete control of the Oasis. A simple RHYME appears as a subtitle in front of Halliday he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: Three hidden keys open three secret gates/ Wherein the errant will be tested for worthy traits/ And those with the skill to survive these straits/ Will reach the end where the prize awaits. Now here is the clue for the first key...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival boards a high-speed train. His HUD IMAGE OF CRED appears and is lightened by 10 coins. Everything in the O costs something.  22. He takes a seat next to two ridiculously proportioned WOM who chat loudly. Parzival MUTES them.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The corporate overlords at IOI weren't as excited about the contest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Push in on three sleek skyscrapers in gleaming downtown Columbus, Ohio in the shape of the letters IOI.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The thought of new ownership terrified them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the building, a sea of workers in rows of Haptic Decks. A buzzing hive of activity; like a trading firm, a working to solve Anorak’s challenge.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They started their own division of egg hunters. We see all of the IOI EMPLOYEES AVATARS have the same def outfits and instead of names, NUMBERS. All of them start a “six”.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We call em “Sixers” ‘cause that’s the rule, no name, just numbers. They put this Kardash named Nolan Sorrento in charge. AN INTERVIEW -- with a slick, ambitious guy in his fortie who is clearly trying to burnish his image. A chyron reads NOLAN SORRENTO, EXECUTIVE VP, IOI.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sorrento was the lead sixer. The face of IOI's team. The program CUTS TO Sorrento giving a tour of his lavish home, trying to show a more human side.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: I love games. I love being inside the Oasis.  23. Despite the fact that his whole house is luxurious, his r is particularly ostentatious: a rotating full body 3D Immersive Haptic Interface, like a hamster ball.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The one luxury I spoil myself with is the best haptic immersion rig money can buy. We see B-Roll of his enormous house, his attractive FAMIL His admittedly cute dog.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Despite the charm offensive, Sorrento was a scary dude. He made his bones in IOI’s security and adjustment division.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A younger Nolan Sorrento leads a team of jack-booted IOI thugs as they break down someone’s door. A TEN YEAR OLD G with a DISTINCTIVE BIRTHMARK watches as Sorrento reads of list of debts to her FATHER, then has him dragged out of house. The girl runs after her father, Sorrento sticks out his f and TRIPS HER.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now he was in charge of IOI’s egg hunt, but you could tell his heart wasn’t in it. INT. SORRENTO’S HOME Sorrento’s interview continues...

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: At IOI, we love hunting for the egg, it’s part of what makes the Oasis so fun. It’s the least convincing expression of enthusiasm ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TRAIN rockets up and out of the city, impossibly fast  24.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The first clue was easy, some long- forgotten gunter cracked it ina week. But the challenge -- the race through Times Square -- was incredibly hard. The train arrives at his stop, one of the many moons of Incipio. A sign at the station reads: MEMOIR-OPOLIS.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Five years went by and no one came close to beating it. Most people gave up. The sixers couldn’t, they had no choice. The rest of us, the Gunters, as in “egg hunters”... well, we didn’t have an excuse. We just had a dream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival strolls down a street lined with what look like homes, but are actually a row of “memory palaces”, basica auto-biographies represented in tangible form.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: At this point, you're probably wondering why a nobody, me, is telling you his life story. The “titles” of these “books” float in front of the memor palaces in various fonts. As this is prime real estate, t are mostly people anyone from 2044 would know.

dialogues.speaker: THE UNABRIDGED LETTERS OF SKRILLEX
dialogues.text: JaRICHARD CHENEY IV, MY LIFE AS A REBEL -- yes, Dick Chen grandson is the dreadlocked, blunt-smoking leader of the Rebs, known as JRC. That was him on the kid’s t-shirt earlier.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Point is this; I tell my story cause that's what Halliday did. He knew our lives would be memorialized in the Oasis, and people like me would want to know. Parzival passes “OGDEN MORROW, MY LIFE SO FAR”.  25. Finally he comes to the building he’s looking for; HALLID JOURNALS .

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And if that seems grandiose on my part, if this seems like some rand- o day in the life of some rand-o nobody, it’s not. This is the day I stopped being a nobody. INT. HALLIDAY’S JOURNALS - OASIS Parzival enters a large lobby with many doors, each of th heading into a different part of Halliday’s life. THE HISTORIAN, a doddering NPC with an attitude, suddenly appears before him. (An NPC is a bot, an AI).

dialogues.speaker: HISTORIAN
dialogues.text: Parzival. How shocking to see you here.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: What’s up, not-real but sarcastic program?

dialogues.speaker: HISTORIAN
dialogues.text: So, Halliday’s childhood again? Comb through his VHS library? Chew up my valuable search time?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Nah, today I need to check out something pretty obscure. Halliday’s one mistake. The Historian raises an eyebrow, intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: HISTORIAN
dialogues.text: His mistake. Flunkie Sprat Three?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: (nods ) Yeah. This girl said something to me, I’ve been thinking about it all day.

dialogues.speaker: HISTORIAN
dialogues.text: I'm feigning interest.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: (ignoring that) I mean, maybe it’s cause she’s hot. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If she had said “I love pork rinds,” would I be thinking about pork rinds? Possibly...

dialogues.speaker: HISTORIAN
dialogues.text: Please, go on, I’m fascinated. He isn’t.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Damn, now I am thinking about pork rinds.

dialogues.speaker: HISTORIAN
dialogues.text: Is that the end? Great story, Parzival.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: My point is, what if he made a mistake? INT. HALLIDAY’S JOURNALS - HALLWAY The Historian leads Parzival to a door. Parzival opens it steps inside.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: With the contest, I mean. What if he made a mistake on purpose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for the presence of Parzival and the Historian, the recreation is absolutely flawless. We ARE in 1993, in the offices of Gregarious Games, where a much younger James Halliday, hung over, can’t stop talking about his night.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: She's incredible, Ogden. I mean... I never met anyone like her. I drank too much, like an idiot, I’m a total lightweight. A frustrated OGDEN MORROW, rotund, with an unruly beard a wire-rimmed spectacles, is Halliday’s partner. He inspect the code Halliday has written for PD3.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: (re: the code) What did you do here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She told me to call her. Do I do that tomorrow? When? I’m terrible at this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: Data is leaking all over the place.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: I really do wonder why people bother with relationships, it’s incredibly messy and confusing.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: Yeah, partnerships are that way too. Morrow pushes back from the desk.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You blew it this time, Hal.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: I got the level finished.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: Oh, it’s finished. With one minor bug. You did it backwards. Flunkie starts at the end and sprats his way backwards to the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: Can’t we just reverse the...

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: The scene suddenly freezes. Parzival turns to the Histori

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Play again from minor bug.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: «+. minor bug. You did it backwards. Hold on Parzival, wide eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade suddenly yanks the haptic visor off, breathing heavi He’s got it.  28.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A new crowd of RACERS wait at the starting line with thei cars. Aside from the usual, indistinguishable sixers, we see SH and DAITO. Both are Japanese, in their twenties, bearing striking resemblance to one another. They each wear match suits of traditional samurai armor, a short wakizashi and longer katana strapped to their belts. They also drive matching Speed Racer cars. Parzival walks towards his DeLorean, in the center lane.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: Hey Parzival, what‘’s up? They speak in Japanese, which we hear faintly, because it instantly translated to English.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Shoto, Daito.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: Dude, you're in the newb lane.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Just testing out a new engine Aech threw in. Daito nods. Shoto seems unconvinced. Parzival gives the gunter salute.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: First to the key.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO DAITO
dialogues.text: First to the egg. First to the egg.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE STARTING LINE --
dialogues.text: The race begins with a gunshot and instantly Shoto, Daito the Sixers speed off. Parzival’s DeLorean doesn’t move. As the rest of the racers disappear around a curve, Parzi puts his car in REVERSE and drives backward, and then...  29.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ground gives way and the DeLorean lands with a thump the sewer system. Parzival stomps on the accelerator and car AUTOMATICALLY GOES BACKWARDS. Parzival laughs as he shoots through a winding tunnel. Then the sewer ramps UP and the DeLorean shoots out back the race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he emerges, and because he is driving backwards, Parzi can instantly see that he is way ahead of the pack and EV OBSTACLE in the game is FALLING BEHIND HIM. He can see the T-REX licking its claws and waiting on 54t street, the CRANE not yet toppled, the CEMENT TRUCK not y moving. He can even see the TRAIL OF THE METEOR on a trajectory towards the park. It doesn’t matter, it’s all behind him. He sees Shoto and Daito crash, then glances in his rearview. He’s just ente Central Park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DeLorean SPINS OUT and ends up facing forward RIGHT A BETHESDA FOUNTAIN. Parzival gets out. As he walks towards the fountain, he c AECH up in a video-chat window.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: What’s up 2?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Aech, my good friend.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Great question. Do you recognize this? PARZIVAL flips AECH to HIS POV...

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: WAIT. Bethesda Fountain? No. Oh my god. Dude! You made it!  30. As Parzival walks around the fountain, interference cause his HUD to disappear, hanging up on Aech. Probably becaus he’s so close to...

dialogues.speaker: THE COPPER KEY
dialogues.text: Parzival snatches it out of the air. He stares at the key a long moment, then can't resist: HE HOLDS IT UP LIKE EXCALIBUR.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I... am... PARZIVAL! His bellow echoes out over the park. He feels a bit stupi for a second. Then a DOOR APPEARS. Parzival sticks the key in, and the door opens. As he doe we WHIP AROUND THE OASIS in what some might call...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aech is standing on a distant planet, impatiently waiting a TRANSPORT SPOT to open up. A BRILLIANT LIGHT IN THE SKY draws his attention. It’s the scoreboard! There’s a name at the top now... Parzival. If Aech had programmed his avatar to cry, it wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis is in a private chat room -- unlike Aech’s, it is austere and functional -- with her GUNTER CLAN. Conversat is hushed, secretive. Then a KNOCK at the door startles t everyone pulls their weapons (various guns and blasters a knives). Artemis checks the peephole. It’s one of her clan members excitedly knocking on the door.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Arty! Ya gotta come check this out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis steps outside and appears next to her clan mate. Planet Doom is experiencing a rare, momentary peace. Artemis looks up, to see why. It’s the Scoreboard.  31.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Ho... lee... She smiles, ear to ear. As we zoom to our next location..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A massive VIRTUAL BOARD MEETING is taking place, NOLAN SORRENTO’s avatar is making a presentation about “The Loy Initiative”, a program that involves the construction of multiple LOYALTY CENTERS around the world. On an interactive MAP, we see there’s one in Columbus, on Oklahoma City, and many more planned. Then... Something catches Sorrento’s eye. Out the window. His voi drifts off...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SORRENTO walks out onto an outdoor executive deck. He can that THOUSANDS OF SIXERS have filed out into the courtyar below, all gazing and pointing at the sky like extras ina Spielberg film. He looks up to see..... FULL REVEAL -- THE SCOREBOARD, shining brightly in the ni sky above. There are ten spaces that for five years have been empty. But now...

dialogues.speaker: 1ST PLACE
dialogues.text: Just to hear it said, Sorrento repeats the single name th has suddenly jeopardized everything he believes in.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Parzival.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival suddenly appears on a street on Incipio, the key hanging around his neck. It takes him a moment to notice, then he realizes that everyone is staring up in the sky, pointing. He looks up see his name up there, as big as the sun.  32. Parzival is absorbing the magnitude of this when his HUD suddenly comes up and his COIN COUNTER shoots from 827 to 100,000. Instantly.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Sweet Mama Cass! Then his message queue pops up. He has over fifty thousan messages waiting for him, the number jumps by another thousand every second.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hello, World. Then he hears voices...

dialogues.speaker: VOICES
dialogues.text: Parzival! Look, Parzival! It’s him! He’s been spotted. Parzival laughs as he is surrounded by AVATARS, all looki for a word or a chance to look at the key, or even just a moment next to the most famous man in the Oasis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In stark contrast to the Oasis, in real life Wade sits in Aunt’s apartment in the Stacks, drumming his fingers. Waiting. HIS POV -- Aunt Alice, wearing their only haptic deck, is "working", pointing left and right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade, burning off nervous energy, walks around the Stacks checking the time and occasionally glancing at the sky. INT. WADE’S APARTMENT -- LATER (REAL WORLD) RICK is now wearing the haptic deck, playing some sort of lame first person shooter. He contorts his body and compl as he keeps getting shot.  33.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: That’s bullshit! You didn’t hit me. You're cheating! This game is friggin’ rigged. WADE watches mutely from the kitchen. No way he can get b online. It’s like a nightmare. EXT. WADE’S STACK (REAL WORLD) Wade is now standing outside the stacks, checking the tim and watching the skies. The REB KIDS are spray-painting t side of a stack.

dialogues.speaker: REB
dialogues.text: Hey look, it’s the loser!

dialogues.speaker: REB 2
dialogues.text: Eat a dickbagel, loser! Wade looks over at the kids and double takes. Their t-shirts? A PICTURE OF PARZIVAL holding up the JADE KEY! Someone’s screengrab that they printed up and sold. causes Wade to burst out laughing.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Nice shirts.

dialogues.speaker: REB 2
dialogues.text: They are nice, butt-chee.

dialogues.speaker: REB
dialogues.text: What’s so funny?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You, mostly. Wade notices a DRONE dropping from the sky, heading towar them. One of the reb kids grabs his air rifle... Wade snatches it out of his hands.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Don’t even think about it. The kids are taken aback by Wade’s sudden confidence. The drone lands beside Wade and a signature screen pops u Wade signs it and the package releases.

dialogues.speaker: REB
dialogues.text: Those aren't socks.  34.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You're a pair of socks. Get out of here. Wade tosses them the air gun. The kids run away. Amazing a little confidence will do. INT. WADE’S HIDEOUT (REAL WORLD) Like a kid on Christmas Day, Wade tears open the package. It’s the SHAPTIC@ BRAND HAPTIC BOOTSUIT, the same one he’ been looking at every day out his window.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Oh yes, my sweet, sweet love. He hugs the suit to his chest, the happiest kid in the wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nolan Sorrento’s avatar stands in the middle of an enormo white sand desert. He waits impatiently, when suddenly... A SPACESHIP DROPS DOWN in front of him, kicking up a clou sand. It looks similar to SLAVE 1, Boba Fett’s ship from Wars, but not so similar that a lawsuit could be filed. A MASSIVE WARRIOR emerges from the ship, A SPACE KNIGHT, in black, weapons bristling across his body. Imagine the Hound from Game of Thrones crossed with a goth Master Chi from Halo.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Six, old friend, how are you? This is NUMBER SIX, an Oasis Bounty Hunter, and he is sca as shit, except for his voice. It’s incongruously nasal a unintimidating.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: I'm okay, I’ve got a neck thing, some sort of carpal tunnel deal but in your neck? So if you could stay on this side of me... He motions for Sorrento to step to his left.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.  35.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Thanks, just the repetitive stress, you know...

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: I get it. I have a job for you, Six.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Yeah, kinda figured that when you sent me the message about having a job for me. Who’s the target? Sorrento flings a “DATA PACKET” at Six. It instantly unfo into a HUD filled with info. NUMBER SIX (CONT’D) Duh. Should’ve seen that coming. IN THE HUD -- All known information about PARZIVAL. Not j the obvious stuff, like his status as leader of the challenge, this has his entire Oasis history, all his achievements, every XP hunt, power-up purchase, porn plan visit... it’s all there. Everything except his real world identity. NUMBER SIX (CONT’D) Not gonna be easy. Guy’s got a lot of eyes on him.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: That’s why I came to you. You're the best.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Riiight. Six pushes the data aside. NUMBER SIX (CONT’D) Before I bust my ass, how many other haxorz have you put on this?

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Six, why would I hire anyone else? You're my guy.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay, well I’m gonna need a higher daily budget than usual. And I’m gonna need help, as in manpower.  36.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: The Sixer Army is at your disposal.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: I said “help” not a bunch of deadbeat level-one shart-squirters to trip over.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: If you think it’s too difficult...

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. You can skip the mind games, Nolan. You know I’m in. The giant warrior turns and heads back to his ship...

dialogues.speaker: SIX
dialogues.text: Owww. He moans and grabs his neck as he boards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aech’s Spaceship rockets through the Oasis, away from the galaxy’s center towards the less populated rim.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I like your facial expressions. Much more detailed. INT. AECH’S SPACESHIP Aech and Parzival are hanging in the cockpit of Aech’s sw ride, talking about Wade’s new Shaptic Brand Bootsuit.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Think so?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Yeah, but was it worth it? Those rigs are pricey.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I can feel the Corinthian leather under my ass, that’s how sensitive this thing is.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Worth it! Changed my mind.  37. Aech gives Parzival a triple-slap high-five, which in the 2040's is the cool way to do it. EXT. VENDOR’S MOON -- Aech’s spaceship descends towards a MOON that looks like is made entirely from WOOD. INT. VENDOR’S WORKSHOP - DAY In the center of an enormous space that makes the warehou at the end of Raiders look like a closet, a man known onl the VENDOR (played by DAVID CROSS because literally, this a David Cross branded avatar, with maximum sarcasm enable constructs a personalized PLANET, MADONNA’S 100th BIRTHDA WORLD. He uses his right hand to shape and mold, his left to add texture and color. Bits of color and pixels of matter fal the ground like glitter. He finishes off an ERUPTING VOLCANO and places it in the center of an ocean. Without turning around...

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Where’s my robot, Aech? Reveal Aech and Parzival approaching from a distance.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Hey man, someone I want you...

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Where is my Giant Robot, Aech? From the movie Iron Giant, a heartwarming tale about a friendship between a human boy and a Giant Robot?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I'm working...

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Where is it? Why don’t I have it? Did we not say I would have it this week?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: (quickly) This is Parzival!  38.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: You... if... what? (to Parzival) The Parzival?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: That’s me.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: So what are we after, a used planet? Real estate in an undeveloped solar system? The Vendor grabs a sheaf of paper from off a table and UNFURLS it. It stretches out into an enormous, stunning, HUNDRED FOOT LONG MAP of every planet in the Oasis.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: How about your own signage floating in the rings of Googleworld? I have a signsmith with fonts that will literally make you cry.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I just need a ship. Something fast. The Vendor smiles, snaps the map closed.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Spaceships are my jam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The contents of a SHOEBOX are dumped on a worktable, matchbox size versions of the Starship Enterprise, the Battlestar Galactica, and other iconic spacecraft.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: I just got a wonderful Guild spice ship that folds space like a boss. Parzival shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How about this George Melies- inspired stop-motion-esque rocket? Very classy.  39.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Kind of had my heart set on this one. He picks up “Serenity”, the spaceship from the show “Firefly”. The Vendor frowns.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Oh, joy, another Whedonite. Personally, I never saw the appeal, insular and twee and smug. Still, can’t deny it’s a well built vessel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “Vonnegut”, as Parzival has renamed it, is now comple He circles it, inspecting it from every angle.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: It’s amazing.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: So you really did it. You got the first key.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Course.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Can I see it? Parzival turns to look at the Vendor. He seems desperate.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not gonna go Gollum on you, kid.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Okay, sure. Parzival takes the key from around his neck and hands it him. The Vendor's eyes light up as he turns the key over his hands.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: The Copper Key. See how perfect that is, down to the pixel? Highest density resolution, just amazing work. In fact, the key is magnificent, like it somehow has more weight, and catches more light, than anything else around  40.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I wondered if anyone would find it. He would have been happy to see someone like you holding this, instead of those IOI beefjugglers.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Wait, did you know Halliday?

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: In some ways, yes. The Vendor looks over his shoulder, to make sure Aech isn listening.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to give you something. You have to promise not to tell Aech, he would be furiously jealous.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure. The Vendor rummages in his pockets. Parzival’s excitement grows, he can only imagine what it could be, this is a gu who can make anything.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR
dialogues.text: Here you go. The Vendor drops a single quarter in Parzival’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: VENDOR, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Remember, don’t tell anyone. As the Vendor walks away, Parzival looks down at the meas quarter and laughs. He flips it, then adds it to his INVENTORY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade straps into the driver’s seat of the Vonnegut. The s rockets through the open bay door of the planetoid and accelerates into space. INT. WADE’S HIDEOUT (REAL WORLD) Wade, in his full body bootsuit, is taking the thrill rid his life. He steers with a virtual wheel, accelerates wit virtual thrust, flips switches on a virtual switchboard.  41.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of which is rendered in loving detail inside the Vonnegut. Parzival deftly navigates two oncoming ships, a massive GROUPON DEAL-HAULER and some tween girl’s HELLO K shuttle, then loops through the BROKEN RINGS of the FACEB PLANET, which has been dormant for years.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: “The place where lovers couldn’t leap/ In the dark, while counting sheep/ Take the jump, prove how you’re made/ Then you will find the key of Jade.” That mean anything to you, Kitt? The voice of his onboard computer, KITT, responds.

dialogues.speaker: KITT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No, sir. Parzival puts the ship on autopilot, then calls up a map his HUD.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Clearly some sort of jump. So many options. Set a course for Lover's Leap, in the Valentine's Day sector on Hallmark 4.

dialogues.speaker: KITT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Very good, sir. As the ship hurtles through space, his HUD operates like FIND FRIENDS app, showing that ARTEMIS is nearby, on PLAN DOOM.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Locate. His Hud spins for a moment, but Artemis isn’t available. leaves a message.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey, it’s me. Z. Ha ha, that rhymed. He abruptly stops and DELETES the message. He tries again

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Howdy... (disgusted with himself) What the hell, am I a cowboy now? Act like a human being, Wade.  42. Now he gets his shit together.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Artemis, it’s Z. I’m in your neck of the woods, thought maybe I’d drop by. Anyway, I wanna thank you for helping me figure out the first challenge. So here’s me helping you out. Go backwards. And let’s meet up sometime. You know, just to hang or... whatever. He pauses for a moment, wondering if he should do this. T he SENDS the message. EXT. THE VONNEGUT --— The Vonnegut suddenly rockets forward. As it does, reveal that another craft SPEEDS UP AS WELL, not quite as fast, clearly trying not to be seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The interior of Number Six’s ship reveals a one-man bount hunting operation. He has a live surveillance feed of the Vonnegut, simultaneous from five different angles. He’s also got what must be an ILLEGAL FEED of PARZIVAL‘'S personal heads up display, though no sound. THE MESSAGE T ARTEMIS becomes visible as it FIRES FROM THE VONNEGUT.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: (voice command) Lock me on to that bitch, Slave. The Slave Six SUDDENLY LEAPS INTO PURSUIT OF THE MESSAGE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The race between Parzival’s message and Six in his spaces is so fast that the ship itself appears as A MASSIVE BLUR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the result is that for as long as he can keep up with message, Six can ACTUALLY HEAR IT. It’s warped and broken into pieces, but still audible.  43.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: +. figure out the first challenge... returning the favor... Six smiles despite the G-force distorting his face. He’s something and he knows it.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AECH’S BASEMENT Aech is putting the finishing touches on the IRON GIANT, in his work.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wow, that looks amazing.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: (not looking up) You told her.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: What? Aech turns on him.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: You told her! I can’t believe you told her.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I don’t know what...

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Have you seen the board? Artemis is on it. Aech snaps open a window. A live feed of The Scoreboard reveals Artemis’s name in the number two position.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Well, I just felt like... she helped me.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: That’s not why you gave her the clue. Man, I can’t believe it. What happened to “Guy Friend before Female you want to Date”? And how much have I helped you?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Dude, I’m sorry, I'll totally give you the...

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I don’t want it, okay? I’1l figure it out on my own. Parzival’s call alert starts beeping. He’s too embarrasse answer it.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well? You just gonna let it ring?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Probably vid-spam.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: It’s her, isn’t it? Don’t be a tool, answer it.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Nah, she’s just a girl, man.

dialogues.speaker: ANSWER IT.
dialogues.text: ON SCREEN -- A message from Artemis. “Let’s meet up”. Parzival's thrilled. Aech is annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She could be using you, in fact SHE could actually be a HE. Think about that. Parzival frowns, he hadn’t thought of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An excited Nolan Sorrento, on his headset, practically ru through the Sixer department at IOI.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Backwards? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I watched her get the key. Sorrento runs into the main SIXER BULLPEN. There are doze of Sixers sitting in a hundred top-of-the-line immersion rigs. A monitor above each rig shows us (and Sorrento) exactly what the Sixer in the Oasis is experiencing.  45. Sorrento whistles, loud enough that everyone turns to loo his way.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Listen up! Backwards. That’s your clue. First one to finish the race, raise your hand. The Sixers jump back into action. Sorrento returns to his voice link conversation with Number Six.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do we know about this girl?

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Coming your way. Sorrento taps the monitor closest to him. A single touch scans his ID and instantly displays the information Numbe Six is sending him. NUMBER SIX (CONT’D) Name’s Artemis. She’s got a geek cute thing going. She’s also got a serious rap sheet.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MONITOR --
dialogues.text: A list of every achievement, and infraction, committed by avatar named Artemis. NUMBER SIX (CONT’D) Board bans, game suspensions, digital vandalism, politics in a no politics zone. Anti-IOI doxxing... Six lets out a laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: What’s so funny? On the monitor, one of Artemis’s Oasis crimes is displaye She is TEABAGGING an NPC in COMPUTER CHESS, but her gamer NOLAN SORRENTO.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s not funny.

dialogues.speaker: SIX
dialogues.text: Kinda funny. Anyway, I think I found Parzival’s weak spot...  46.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: You did. Sorrento’s eyes linger on the picture of ARTEMIS. SORRENTO (CONT’D) It’s her.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: What? No. It’s spaceships.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: She’1l get you what you’re after.

dialogues.speaker: SIXER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Sorrento! I’m in Central Park, sir!

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Don't let me down, Six. Sorrento hangs up and walks over to the immersion rigs. H tugs on the arm of the Sixer who just yelled.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, get out! Sorrento yanks the surprised Sixer’s visor off and puts i himself, then climbs into his rig. We notice a special TH CAP that clicks in to the gloves, and now the interface reads...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento now stands in front of Bethesda Fountain in Cent Park. The copper key just floats there, waiting for him. Sorrento reaches out and GRABS IT.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Booyah! Then he looks around to make sure no one heard that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Scoreboard, huge beyond comprehension, begins to rumb and shake as a new name rolls out into THIRD PLACE. The Vonnegut streaks past, just a speck in the foreground  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival watches in disgust as the THIRD SLOT on the scoreboard changes to the name “NOLAN SORRENTO”. Feeling guilty, Parzival pulls up Aech in his contacts. There’s no response, so Parzival leaves a message.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I should've said something, you’re my best friend. Here’s how to beat the first challenge... And while he explains...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis is making her way through the streets of Planet D Her armor meter is high enough that she doesn’t need to w about crossfire. The occasional bullet or shell pings off and falls to the ground. Then she notices someone following her. It’s IOI Security She speeds up a little, then walks right past the entranc her CLAN CLUBHOUSE, hoping to lose the tail. She turns a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO IOI security guards come around a corner, only to be JUMPED by ARTEMIS. She is completely bad-ass in the Oasis and makes quick work of them with some insane martial art moves combined with a BLASTER that she uses with deadly accuracy. More Security Guards close in, firing more ordinance. Artemis’s shields are starting to take damage. She has to retreat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis is PINNED DOWN in an alley, IOI Security closing from both directions. She ducks out from behind garbage c returning fire, but in a few moments she’1l be overwhelme

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey Artemis...  48. Artemis looks up to see Parzival, standing on a ledge abo her, wearing A PAIR OF RED HEADPHONES. He tosses her a matching pair.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Put these on. She puts them on and them Parzival pulls out a supremely ass RAIL GUN.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just bought this puppy. Check ‘er out. Parzival fires and the gun spits out a super-heated light wave that sprays like a shotgun. The blast incinerates everything in its path, except Artemis, who stands in the center of it, unharmed. An impressed Artemis looks up at Parzival.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Headphones of limitless protection. Keep em, those are my spares. Parzival jumps down to the alley to join her, a fine mist vaporized IOI goons whirls through the air.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So what was that all about?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Long story. Let’s get off the streets. Parzival nods, happy to. As they walk away... Reveal a HOODED FIGURE, watching them from afar. He follo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A comically thin strip of sidewalk is the only safe zone Planet Doom.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Don’t know if I told you this, but I like your look.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: You do?  49.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, I mean, the Atari Game burial t-shirt, very cool. Also, I like that you’re not all ‘roided out.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I hate that.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Your friend...

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I've tried to talk to him about it...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: The shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Too wide, right?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Totally. I mean, nothing personal but... even your arms are a little big. Parzival checks out his arms.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Are they?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: For your frame. I’m just saying, the biceps are kind of... BAM! Parzival’s biceps instantly shrink down a bit.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There you go, a little less Olympic weightlifter. Parzival smiles, motions to Artemis.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I like yours too. I mean, your arms, but I mean like... your butt, it’s not...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Yeah, tried to keep it real.  50.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: And your... you know, your boobs, they’re not those ridiculous porn star...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Those things are a huge liability in a death match. You try to hide, but your cans are sticking out from behind a tree.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yeah. They walk in comfortable silence; definitely a connection forming.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you look like in the real world?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Hey. Boundaries, not cool.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m sorry, I just... it would be... you know, to meet you. In person.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: You'd be disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: No I wouldn't. (then) Are you a guy?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I’m just saying, I don’t care what you look like. I'd like to meet you. I mean, I have no idea where you live, and I’m sure you'd be disappointed in me but...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Shhh! Artemis motions to more IOI SECURITY GUARDS up ahead, searching for their missing quarry. They duck behind a billboard advertising MADDEN 74.  51.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Parzival, listen...

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: My real name is Wade.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: No! Are you crazy? You can’t tell anyone who you are.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I’m not telling anyone. I’m telling you.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: And you don’t know me, you don’t know anything about me. IOI is after me, they’re definitely after you. This isn’t a game, Z.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Uh, yeah, I think it is.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Well, you’re wrong. It’s not. A hovering graphic up ahead indicates END OF NON PVP ZONE Artemis stops.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Z, seriously, what would you do if you found the egg? Parzival is taken aback, almost like he hasn’t really tho this through.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I don’t know, I mean, what wouldn’t I do? Buy myself the best rig, the biggest space ship... I’d get all the shit I could never afford.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: And what about the Oasis?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I'd keep it like it is, I guess, like it should be.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: That's the thing, Z, it isn’t how it should be. Not anymore. Whoever wins this, they’re going to need to work to keep things free.  52.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I'm not really that into politics

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: It's more than politics, it's basic human decency. IOI has all this double speak about “maximizing bandwidth potential,” but what it really means is the Oasis is screwed.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: That's why it’s so important that we win. We need you, Z. My clan needs you. Parzival suddenly realizes.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Oh. Oh man.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Aech was right. I’m an idiot. (embarrassed) I thought... I thought you wanted to hang.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: (not getting it) I want to do more than hang, I want to clan up.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: That’s not-- nevermind. It’s cool. I better go. He pulls the miniature Vonnegut out of his pocket and TOS it into the middle of the street. It instantly expands to full size. Artemis is confused by his sudden attitude.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wait, so what’s your answer?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Lemme think about it, okay? Artemis, bewildered, just watches as his ship rockets awa  53. Watching all this from a distance, the figure who was following them removes his hood. It’s NUMBER SIX.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade is sleeping in his tiny room when he hears pounding his door.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Wade! Get out here! Wade pulls some pants on, heads out of his room. INT. WADE’S LIVING ROOM - DAY Wade walks into the living room to find Alice and Rick waiting for him. They’ve got his backpack open on the tab

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Wade? Can you explain this? Rick, wearing a “Parzival” hat that makes Wade doubletake holds up Wade's fancy Bootsuit.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Can I explain why you guys are going through my stuff? No, I can’t. Wade tries to grab the bootsuit, but Rick holds him back.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: This thing costs at least ten thousand credits. Where’d you get the money?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Did you steal it?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I bought it.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: You doing those sex chats?  54.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What? No. Ew. Why do you care anyway, Rick? You don’t even live here.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: Neither do you.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Rick!

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Alice? What’s he talking about?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: We're selling the trailer, Wade. She slides a LOYALTY CENTER PAMPHLET towards Wade. It's g the IOI logo on it, and reads: ‘Work off your debt in wee at Oklahoma City's new Loyalty Center.' Wade leafs through the pamphlet in shock.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Is this a joke? I don’t want to live in this ass-y gulag.

dialogues.speaker: RICK
dialogues.text: You're not gonna live there. We didn’t apply for you.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What? Wade stares at Alice, looking for an answer.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What am I supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You're getting a little too old not to have your own place. I think your Mom would have wanted...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare bring my Mom into this, Alice. Wade looks really upset. Alice, feeling bad, takes him as  55.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Wade. I know it’s rough. I just don’t know what else to do. It’s really hard to find someone you can bear to be with.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: But Rick?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: We don’t always get our first choice, kiddo. Alice hands Wade her IOI gear.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (whispering) Here, take my stuff. I don’t want to leave you with nothing. Reluctantly he takes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dejected Wade trudges through the stacks, backpack over shoulder, headed for his hideout. As he goes, we hold on a shadowy figure, WATCHING HIM. He big guy in a hoodie, with a really LAME TATTOO. He watche Wade disappear into the piled up cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A rail runs along the edge of a deck that hangs in the up atmosphere. Wind whips furiously, and we reveal Parzival standing on the edge. He looks ready to jump. He sees Aech approaching.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Thanks for finally returning my calls.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I looked deep in my heart and realized, you’re my best friend. How can I stay angry? Aech looks over the edge. It’s at least ten thousand feet the ground.  56.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Plus, you sounded kind of bummed when we talked.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess I am. As if to prove his point, Parzival JUMPS OFF THE EDGE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival free-falls. A moment later, Aech joins him.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: So you gotta move out?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I mean, they didn’t give me any warning.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: That’s rough. How'd it go with the girl? Parzival shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Don’t ask. Yes, they are still hurtling towards the ground at termin velocity, but the conversation is as casual as if they we chatting over coffee.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t really know anyone. Where do I even go? Where do I log in? Can’t believe my Aunt is doing this.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: You don't get to choose your family. But I'm your friend, even in the R.W. So if you need help, you call me, okay? Parzival looks over at Aech. Despite the fact that he loo like a linebacker and is falling through space at high sp he can see the sincerity behind his words.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Thanks, dude.  57.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Now pull your ripcord. They pull their chutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival and Aech leave the RED BULL GLUTEN-PACKED ENERGY LEAP, the promotional jump they just tested out.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: So this wasn’t it. The second challenge.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I've tried like ten different famous jumps.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’s the answer. They arrive at Aech’s ship, which is incongruously sittin a parking lot among many other vehicles.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I just don’t think the clue is that literal. Aech climbs on board his ship.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Need a lift? Parzival shakes his head. AECH throws him the gunter salu

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cheer up, dude. You’re still on the board. AECH’S SHIP BLASTS OFF And once it does... A GROUP OF SIXERS ARE REVEALED, five of them, with one ve familiar leader, recognizable even through the smoke.  58.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s good to meet you in person, Parzival. I’m a fan. Seeing NOLAN SORRENTO, Parzival immediately draws his GUN and his SHIELDS power up. Sorrento walks forward.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whoa, take it easy, Hombre. None of us are armed. IN PARZIVAL’S HUD -- a quick scan reveals that he’s telli the truth, no weapons on any of them.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
