dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: To make you an offer.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Not interested.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: This is the kind of offer where you get everything you’ve ever dreamed of. Sorrento motions to a gleaming, blue TRANSPORT DISC, the fastest, and most expensive way to get around the Oasis.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Five minutes, just hear me out, that’s all I ask. Off Parzival, debating whether to step onto that platform

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The IOI executive transport sits on a gated platform at o end of the Courtyard in One IOI Plaza. Sorrento, Parzival the Sixers zap in.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: I understand why people don’t like IOI. I really do. Everyone wants to stick it to the man. Sorrento leads them off the platform and into the courtya below.  59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The courtyard of IOI’s Oasis Headquarters is unimaginativ similar to their real world campus, though everything is bigger and more ostentatious.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: And I like a good treasure hunt as much as the next person. But could you imagine if these so-called “rebs” won the contest? They walk past a stunning gravity-defying fountain toward the massive towers.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They'd dismantle the place in weeks.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Is that what they say?

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: That’s what they’d do. You take all the commerce out of the Oasis, it falls apart. Halliday always had a business model, he was no communist. As they move toward the building’s giant glass doors, Parzival sees hundreds of nameless IOI WORKERS filing out side door towards their respective shitty jobs.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: This is where all your employees spawn, huh?

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Yes, but don’t worry, they immediately move off site. The executives -- which you would be -- don’t have to interact with the worker bees. Sorrento points Z to the executive elevator.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll barely ever see them. Parzival notices his AUNT ALICE’S AVATAR among the crowd. Despite his mixed feelings about her, it’s hard for him t feel good about Sorrento’s comment.  60. INT. IOI HEADQUARTERS - SORRENTO’S OFFICE (OASIS) Parzival and Sorrento step out into Sorrento’s opulent office. The windows off the observation deck afford a stunning view of the surrounding virtual city.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: IOI wants you, Parzival. To help find Halliday's Easter egg.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: That's what I figured.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: You'd have everything at your disposal, you’d be free to follow any strategy...

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: But if I win, IOI would run the Oasis.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: You'd rather run it yourself? Parzival looks at Sorrento quizzically. SORRENTO (CONT’D) Do you know how hard it is to maintain the Oasis? Do you know how many hours a day Halliday worked?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Twenty hours a day... Twenty hours, that’s right. SORRENTO (CONT’D) That's what it takes. Is that the kind of person you are? Parzival considers this. He is definitely not a “20 hours day” kind of guy.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our offer won’t require twenty hours a day. But it does come with your own penthouse apartment in Columbus, with the highest speed connection, and the best deck money can buy. This gets Parzival’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You'll have all of our company's vast resources at your disposal. Money, weapons, magic items, ships, artifacts. You name it. And I haven’t even gotten to how well this job pays.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I don’t think I can be a sixer, it’s...

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: (interrupting) Two million a year. To start.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Oh. Shit.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Regardless of outcome. And if and when you help us find the egg? You'll get a twenty-five-million- dollar bonus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival says nothing... INT. WADE’S HIDEOUT (REAL WORLD) While in real life, a hyperventilating Wade has to take h visor off just to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Holy crap. He slips it back on. INT. SORRENTO’S OFFICE (OASIS) Parzival looks pretty cool as he considers Sorrento’s off

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Look, Z, I know you’re using emotion-suppressing software right now, and why wouldn’t you? It’s smart not to give away your hand. In the background, the planet's simulated sun begins to s casting a glow over the room. It’s actually quite beautif  62.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But one thing I can tell you is that life is a lot easier when you have money in the real world. Relationships are easier. Parzival isn’t sure what he’s getting at, but it definite makes him think.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: When you say we... One question...

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: (knows the question) As our employee, you’d be playing on behalf of IOI.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: So IOI would own the Oasis?

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: We would own it, Wade. All of us who work at IOI. Well, all of us who own stock.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: But we keep Halliday’s rules? Equal access, equal bandwidth... Sorrento tightens, tries to smile. This is a bit of a sor subject.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Ah yes, equal bandwidth, Halliday’s dream. Do you know how much that slows things down, Wade? It’s a lovely idea, but do you know how much faster and better the Oasis can be? If we maximize the bandwidth potential for income? ON PARZIVAL -- hearing those buzzwords, maximize bandwidt potential. It strikes a chord.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Your 25 million will be worth fifty million two months after IOI takes over. That's a guarantee. Fifty million, is that a good deal?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, no. Sorrento’s face falls.  63.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'm probably going to really regret this, but I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: I’m sure you'll regret it, but I understand, I really do. In fact, I'd like to say something off the record.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival shrugs, “why not?” With a wave of his hand, Sorrento disables all the camera and microphones in the room. SORRENTO (CONT’D) The truth is, I had to make this offer. The Board insisted. But I was really hoping you would say no. Because if anyone wins, it’s going to be me. My avatar will get that egg, because the truth is, I am the only one with the balls to run this place right.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Wow, you kind of switched gears there from “fairly reasonable” to “maniacal overlord”.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Ha, funny. There’s the obnoxious wit I’ve heard about. Well, consider yourself lucky, Wade, because you won’t be around to experience my “maniacal” reign. Parzival reacts. Did he just say “Wade”? Sorrento gets a wicked grin on his face. SORRENTO (CONT’D) Yes, that’s right. I know who you are. Wade Owen Watts. Born August twelfth, 2024. Both parents deceased. I also know where you are. A vidfeed window opens directly behind Sorrento, displayi live aerial view of Wade’s Stacks. SORRENTO (CONT’D) You live with your aunt in the Stacks. 700 Portland Avenue in Oklahoma City. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Unit 56-K, to be exact. You were last seen entering her trailer three days ago and you haven't left since. Which means you're still there right now, and there’s no time to get out. He puts a hand on Parzival’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m sorry Wade, it really wasn’t personal. Parzival suddenly blinks out. Sorrento turns back to the vidfeed monitor, watching as IOI DRONES approach the Stac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But of course, Wade isn’t IN the Stacks, he’s in his hide He tears off his haptic gear and scrambles out of the van

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade SPRINTS towards his stack, trying to reach Alice on headset.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Alice! Alice! You gotta get the hell out of there-- OVERHEAD, Wade can see more DRONES closing in on his stac They look like they are carrying packages, but as each of them flies in-- They maneuver towards his stack and plant their packages the support struts of the unit... Red lights on their side blink faster and faster. Wade frantically calls out to his Aunt.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: C'mon Alice, pick up... But Rick answers.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, this bootsuit is pretty awesome, thanks for that...  65.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Rick, get out of there! The place is gonna blow! Rick starts laughing.

dialogues.speaker: RICK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hear that, Alice? This douchenozzle is-- And that, sadly, is the last thing Rick ever says...

dialogues.speaker: KABOOM
dialogues.text: The support columns are blown apart, and the entire Stack begins to teeter... The sound of RENDING METAL pierces Wade’s ears as the sta RIPS FREE of its scaffolding and CRASHES against its neighbor, like a massive domino. Wade watches, frozen in shock and horror as THREE STACKS start falling... TOWARDS HIM. He runs as the massive towers split apart and fall, containers and RV homes flipping and tumbling and catchin fire as PROPANE TANKS EXPLODE. Wade just manages to get clear of the collapse. As sirens wail and people scream... For a moment, Wade just stands there, overcome by the hor of it. Then he notices someone, staring at him. It’s that same G the one with the LAME TATTOO. He’s moving towards him. As Wade slowly backs away, the g follows him. Now Wade starts to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade is running as fast as he can, but this isn’t the Oas his real body is out of shape. He sucks air as he rounds of the Stacks and sees... AN IOI TRANSPORT pull up to the burning stacks and a doze IOI Security Guards hop out.  66. Wade turns and runs in the other direction. Until Lame Tattoo rounds a corner just ahead of him. Wade slides, almost falls down, then turns and runs in the oth direction.

dialogues.speaker: AS THE STACKS BURN
dialogues.text: Wade runs for his life through the wreckage, trying to ge back to cover, his Hideout. He almost runs into another g of IOI goons, but they end up giving him the cover to esc from Lame Tattoo. INT. WADE’S HIDEOUT Wade, still clutching his backpack, climbs into his van, of breath. He sits there for a moment, in shock, then starts poundin the steering wheel. Tears stream down his face. After a moment, he catches his breath and tries to calm himself down. EXT. WADE’S HIDEOUT Wade looks both ways before emerging from the hideout. In one direction, the burning remains of the stacks, in the other, the beckoning lights of Oklahoma City. He starts off in that direction when he is suddenly GRABB FROM BEHIND. It’s Lame Tattoo. Before he can scream, he has a GAG in his mouth, plastic cuffs around his wrists. Then a HOOD goes over his head. Everything goes black.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police and ambulances surround the disaster at the stacks IOI clean up CREW picks through the wreckage right alongs the police. We hear chatter among onlookers and police about “an expl meth lab”. IN THE WRECKAGE -- One of the IOI guys pulls out the char remains of...  67. A SHAPTIC BOOTSUIT. As he lifts it up, the ashes of an incinerated body drop out of it. IOI GUY checks the serial number with a scanner. On a sma display screen, the details come up... “Purchaser: WADE WATTS” Satisfied, IOI GUY nods to the others. Their work here is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the hood is pulled off, the world is blurred and too bright. When WADE’S EYES finally adjust, the first thing sees is... A KNIFE. Wade raises his hands defensively, but Lame Tatt just grabs them and... SLICES THE HANDCUFFS. Then he pulls the gag out. Wade coughs, spits. His vision is starting to adjust. He now see someone sitting just across from him. A woman. She looks familiar, dark hair and hazel eyes. She has a prominent BIRTHMARK on her left cheek which she hides wit her new wave hairdo, but otherwise there’s no doubt who i is.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Hey, Wade. Welcome to the rebellion. It’s the real life Artemis, in the flesh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade and Artemis walk through the Reb Safe House. It’s ru down but animated, filled with other young people committ to the cause.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: When I was a kid, we moved around a lot. My Dad was always getting hassled, by the government or corporations or whoever, he just couldn’t catch a break. But he fought for his rights, even when it got him in trouble.  68.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Wow. Sounds rough.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Well, he went broke, and then he abandoned us. But the point is, he taught me never to back down. He refused to give in to the system's injustice. So damn right I picked up the torch. Everyone they pass nods to Artemis. She’s a leader here.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You’re even more badass in real life.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Nah. Artemis leads him past the Reb Oasis War Room, where a bu of Rebs are logged in to haptic rigs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade and Artemis step outside into a rundown neighborhood suburban slum. In the distance he can see the gleaming skyline of COLUMBUS, OHIO.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: That’s Columbus, huh?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: World’s nicest city. If you’re rich and powerful. Otherwise you live out here in the bandwidth slums. She motions to the rundown neighborhood around them.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Never knew it was so bad.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: It isn’t just Columbus. Artemis points to the horizon, where the Slums are expand Favela-like, to cover the Ohio countryside.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s everywhere. IOI messes with access speeds to force more and more people into debt. Case in point.  69. She points to an IOI SECURITY TEAM, accompanied by the POLICE, dragging someone out of his home, The guy has a MOHAWK and wears an ironic “MATRIX KIDS!” t-shirt. His screaming, half-naked girlfriend holds a screaming, total naked baby.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What the hell?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: That was LaJeremy, our neighbor. LaJeremy is pushed into the back of an IOI transport van whisked away.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You fall into enough debt, IOI takes you in for “loyalty service”. Have you ever seen a “loyalty center”, Wade?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Only on a pamphlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An enormous building, like the projects, but there’s no activity outside; everyone is inside, all the time.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: The key to the whole scam is getting around Halliday’s first rule; one person, one avatar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bullpen at the loyalty center is quite literally a SE a THOUSAND HAPTIC DECKS, each with a poor soul in it unde servitude to IOI.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Sorrento came up with the workaround. A way to spoof accounts, so he can take over for a Sixer whenever he wants. But it’s worse than that. We watch some random guy working and working, piling up c from his loyalty rig...  70. ARTEMIS (0.S.) (CONT’D) The “loyalists” don’t have an identity in there. Earnings just go into a shared account. IOI’s. The coins DRAIN OUT OF HIS ACCOUNT just as quickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis and Wade are walking back now.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: No matter how hard they work, their debt goes up. IOI charges them for their deck, their access, and room and board. The Oasis was built to be free. These Loyalty Centers will turn everyone into slaves.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Halliday never would have let this happen.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: I know you love the guy, Wade, and I had a lot of respect for him too, but Halliday knew there were issues, but he never did jack one about it. He wanted the whole world to be a game, and it just isn’t. Wade nods, he’s experienced that first hand. Suddenly the events of the past few days come rushing back. Wade has to stop walking for a moment, he feels dizzy.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You okay? Wade sits down on the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wade?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: They killed my Aunt. She was a jerk to me, but she still raised me, she didn’t deserve to die. None of them did. (turning to her) And you saved my life. Wade’s eyes are tearing up.  71.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aw man, I must look pathetic. Artemis dries his tears, she holds his face in her hands.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Stop it. You’ve been through hell. And you're not pathetic, you're the number one gunter in the world. That is bad ass. Wade and Artemis are incredibly close now, his face just inches from hers. It feels like one of those moments... But they just sit there, awkwardly. Wade can’t make the m The moment is gone.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We should get back before the patrols start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis leads Wade into the Oasis War Room. Wade pulls hi Aunt’s IOI gear out of his backpack. Artemis shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Oh. Right, IOI can trace it? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Now you're getting the hang of it. Wade gets into one of the empty rigs. Artemis watches as does some quick customization, cleaning off the haptic receivers with his shirt, balling up the cord on his head so it doesn’t snag. Artemis is impressed; when it comes to the Oasis, Wade is pro. She even imitates him, pulling slack on her cords, a she gets in her rig. INT. AECH’S BASEMENT - NIGHT Aech is in his basement, studying a smaller version of th Vendor's Oasis Map.  72.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Enhance. Despite looking like a real map, the image ZOOMS IN. Aech refers to a few different MARKED LOCATIONS where “The Lea might be.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gotta be the Brooklyn Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Nope, not the answer. Aech turns to see Parzival entering, Artemis right behind him.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Z! I was worried about you, man. He and Z do their elaborate high-five move. The one that really is cool. Aech nods to Artemis, somewhat less enthused. The feeling mutual.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Are they here?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: (nods ) They’re here. SHOTO and DAITO step forward.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Shoto, Daito, this is Artemis. Artemis takes a small bow.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of all the gunters, Shoto and Daito are the two most skilled fighters I've ever seen. They're maxed out on all PVP categories. Shoto and Daito bow back to Artemis.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You guys all got my message? Aech, are you someplace safe?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I’m on the run.  73. Parzival turns to Shoto and Daito.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Same for you two. If you're with us, they’1ll come looking for you. Parzival pauses, then addresses the group.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A good friend told me that we would be better off working together. I didn’t listen to him. Aech is a bit embarrassed, he knows it’s him.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I thought Halliday wanted us to do it alone, but that’s only how he would’ve done it. I think he wanted someone to be better than him.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: So we’re clanning up?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yes. (to Artemis) But I’m not joining your clan. Artemis is confused. Wade turns to Shoto.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Shoto) Not yours either. (to the group) We are the Clan. Right here in this room, this is the Oasis Dream Team. We're the “first five” and we are going to win this thing together or not at all. Murmurs of agreement from everyone, except Artemis.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Z, you know it’s not that easy for me, I’m committed.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Does your Clan know how to find the second challenge?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: No, of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you? Everyone turns to look at Z. He smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yes. (to Artemis) 74. Don’t want to put you on the spot, but if you're with us, you’re with us. Artemis nods.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Okay. I’m in.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: So spill, where’s the jump?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: There is no jump.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Skeptical, but intrigued.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: “Where lovers wouldn’t leap.” It hit me today. It’s about a girl. (meeting Artemis’ eye) And the leap he didn’t take. Artemis doesn’t seem to get Parzival’s meaning, but Aech does.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: After they blew the Flunkie Sprat job, Halliday and Morrow met to work on a new idea. It was a seminal moment in history.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gregarious games headquarters, circa 1998. laptop, Halliday paces.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: I don’t think that’1l track.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: Just try it, Og. Morrow hits a button, the machine renders, Morrow sits at his SLOWLY.  75.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL --
dialogues.text: That our assembled team is watching the scene together in Halliday Journals. The Historian is there as well. Parziv monologues.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I’ve watched the scene a million times, the night they sketched the plans for the Oasis. It took sixteen years to make it work, but this is where it began. Bored, Morrow leans back in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: So, how was it?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: I missed the voiceover. I don’t care what people say, I like the voiceover.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: You know that’s not what I mean. Halliday, frustrated, paces quickly now.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What happened with her?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: She thought it was kind of dull, can you believe that?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: This is the same girl Halliday was swooning over months before. He took her to a movie, but he still hadn’t taken the leap. Morrow shakes his head, it’s like pulling teeth with him.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: What does that have to do with getting your mack on?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: It just bothers me, it was a bomb when it came out, how can people not recognize genius?  76.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: Ahead of its time. Like us. But Jim... did she....

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: She invited me back to her place.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Nothing happened.

dialogues.speaker: STOP
dialogues.text: Parzival turns to Aech.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: See what I’m talking about? “Counting sheep.” That’s what gives it away.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: (catching his drift) “Do Androids dream of electric sheep...” Right. I mean, you forget because he says it was a bomb...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: (figuring it out) Wait, it was a bomb?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Way ahead of its time. The Citizen Kane of dystopic future noir films.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: You think this is the clue to the key?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Definitely. The Historian clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: HISTORIAN
dialogues.text: I know I’m a computer program and I should know this, but what movie are you talking about? They all look at him, disappointed. Then, together...  77.

dialogues.speaker: ALL
dialogues.text: Blade Runner!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vonnegut rockets across the Oasis Solar System, once again passing the enormous SCOREBOARD. We hear Parzival’s voice, pre-lapped.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Everyone knows Blade Runner has its fingerprints all over the Oasis, in the architecture, the vision of the future, even the avatars. The Vonnegut shoots towards a large planet with a number orbiting moons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A row of MOVIE THEATERS extends to the horizon, each of t playing one of Halliday’s favorite movies: War Games, Sta Wars, Raiders, Road Warrior, Terminator, Ferris Bueller, Action Hero, all of the Monty Python movies...

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: But if you know Halliday, you know that one of the first things he built in the Oasis was a place for his favorite movies. Our fabulous five come to a marquee with BLADE RUNNER: ORIGINAL EDITION on it.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: So, what, we’re gonna watch Blade Runner?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Something tells me there'll be more to it than that. They pass through the doors of the movie theater, and are suddenly transported to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HARRISON FORD as Deckard sits at his counter seat at the noodle parlor. People speak crazy polyglot languages. It literally -- Blade Runner.  78. Parzival, Aech, Artemis, Shoto and Daito suddenly appear the middle of the crowded street.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: Whoa. We’re IN Blade Runner?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: It’s the immersive cut. (looking around) Think it’s the Oculus Criterion Edition.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Yeah, but this isn’t the beginning of the movie.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: We're what, eight minutes in?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Nine forty I believe. Parzival notices a counter in the corner of the screen, g down from three hours.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But that’s not what’s in our HUDs. Stay on your toes, people, this is the challenge.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: I wonder what we’re supposed to do?

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: Let’s just go ask Deckard. Shoto immediately heads over towards the noodle shop. Dai follows him.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Hold on, that might not be... But they’ve already gotten close enough.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: «+. the best idea.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: Hey, Deckard. Deckard looks up at Shoto for a moment, then he pulls out gun and SHOOTS HIM. The rest of them scatter.  79. Daito takes a bullet to the back and dies too. He and Sho are both dead in the challenge, though they can still be heard arguing in Japanese over voice chat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival, Artemis and Aech hide in a side alley.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Well, now we know what the challenge is.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Do we?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: We're replicants, the bad guys.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: They weren’t the bad guys, they were misunderstood. They’re more like the Na’vi in Avatar.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Whatever dude, split hairs.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: We expire in less than three hours. Not much time. What should we do?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Something in the clue, “prove how you're made”. That’s the key. To the key. Come on. He grabs Artemis’s hand and leads her away. Aech reluctan follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival, Artemis, and Aech walk through the office build from the opening scene, the one with the ceiling fans and atmospheric smoke. A wall suddenly appears between them, separating them.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Remember what you...  80. Too late, the three of them will each be doing the challe on their own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Parzival slowly approaches a desk with a Voight-Kampff machine sitting on it. He knows which chair is his. To his surprise, instead of Morgan Paull, the original ac ANORAK sits across from him. He’s still got the cigarette the slicked back hair.

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK
dialogues.text: You're walking through a desert and come upon a tortoise... Parzival smiles, he knows this part.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: What’s a tortoise?

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK
dialogues.text: You ever seen a turtle?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Of course.

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK
dialogues.text: Same thing. You reach down and flip it on its back.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Do you make up these questions, Mr. Halliday?

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK
dialogues.text: Just answer the questions. You’re on a date... That throws Parzival, definitely not from the movie.

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: At the movies. Your date invites you to her place for a drink. What do you do? Parzival takes a long pause.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I go with her. A long pause. Then Anorak stands up and extends his hand.  81.

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK
dialogues.text: Alright. You're not a replicant. Anorak hands him a clipboard with the results to his test

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (re: clipboard) Take this down to the next room. When Parzival looks down, the clipboard is now... The JADE KEY. When he looks back up, Anorak has disappeared. And the of door is a JADE DOOR. He turns the key and walks through..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only to find Artemis waiting on the other side. They are outside the movie theaters.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: What the...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Guess I answered quicker. They look up to see the SCOREBOARD... ARTEMIS in the lead, PARZIVAL in second. Aech steps through a moment later.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Damn, you guys beat me? AECH appears on the scoreboard too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento is looking at images of what little is left of t Portland Avenue Stacks, including Wade’s Bootsuit. He tal to NUMBER SIX on his HUD at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, whatever you did to his account, he's back online.  82.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Not possible, I... deleted his account. Permanently. Clearly Six doesn’t know exactly how deep and dirty Sorre goes.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Well, look at the scoreboard. Sorrento checks one of the display screens, sure enough there’s PARZIVAL, second on the Scoreboard, now behind Artemis.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: We have to go about this a different way. Get me her identity.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Gonna cost you extra.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: I don't care, just find out who she is. Sorrento signs off. INT. AECH’S BASEMENT (OASIS) In the Oasis, the First Five clan celebrates their victor singing along to “We Are the Champions”. In a rousing moment, Aech turns to Artemis. He holds up h hand for an old-fashioned high-five.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Nice moves back there.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: (smiles) You too. She clears her throat to get everyone’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay, ready for the third clue? They all clap and whistle. She reads...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The first was ringed in red metal/ The second, in green stone/ (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The third is clearest crystal/ And cannot be unlocked alone. A beat as everyone mulls that over.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: What do you think, some sort of key trick?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Doesn't say anything about where the challenge is.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s the trick.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Whatever, we've got time to figure it out, right? More music! Aech throws another track on, “My Sharona.” They all star dancing again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Oasis War Room at the Reb Safe House. Wade helps Arte out of her gear. She’s humming MY SHARONA to herself.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Never heard that song before, it's awesome. Wade looks at her, incredulous.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (shrugs ) I got into the 80’s stuff cause of the contest, not the other way around. So I guess I've got gaps in my knowledge. The other day some guy said he was gonna pull a “Lloyd Dobler” on me, I had no idea whether to thank him or punch him.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Say Anything?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Hold on.  84. Wade speaks a muffled voice command into his rig, then ho up his headphones. The sound is really good as a SONG COM UP.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: A great song from Halliday’s twenty- seventh favorite movie. MUSIC CUE: “IN YOUR EYES,” BY PETER GABRIEL. They sit together for a moment, just listening to the song.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think? Cynical dicks can turn the page now, but the song has its magic and it WORKS. Artemis smiles, clearly into it.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: How do you know all this stuff, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: My Mom and Dad, that’s what they grew up on. It was all Atari and comic books and Halliday. I didn’t get much time with them, they died when I was a kid, but I did inherit their tastes. Artemis slides closer, so she can hear better. Their legs press against each other. Wade naturally rests his hand o her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: You ever wonder why Halliday did all this? The contest I mean.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I think he was cut off, y’know? He wanted to be understood, but he didn’t know how to talk to people. So this was a way to get them to understand. Artemis nods, makes sense. They just listen to the song f moment.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: So what’s a “Lloyd Dobler?” Wade turns a bit red, then smiles.  85.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Well... it’s when a guy plays a great song for a girl he’s really into, to get her to go out with him.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Oh. She has her hand on his now.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know that thing you said, about not taking a leap...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (already leaning in) Yeah. Before she can finish her thought, Wade completes it by kissing her. He’s surprised that he made the move. She’s surprised how badly she wants to kiss him back. And it’s not just a peck, not an accident, not just of th moment. It’s a long, slow kiss, and the song keeps playin INT. REB SAFE HOUSE - WADE’S ROOM (REAL WORLD) ++. aS Wade and Artemis connect on a more physical level. And by that I mean sex. They have sex with each other. Or however much people feel comfortable with these days, whi is probably more prudish than it should be, but whatever. When it’s over, they fall asleep holding hands. Music takes us through a TIME CUT. When the music ends, a sleeping Wade opens his eyes. Artemis is getting dressed. From the moonlight coming in through the window, it’s cle the middle of the night.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Hey. Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wade...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Sorry if I pulled a “Dobler” on you. Artemis can’t help but smile.  86.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: This was great. I just...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I get it.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: No, I mean, I can’t do this again. I can't be with you. Wade’s smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: I... we both need to be focused on the contest.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: One doesn’t mean the other...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: No, it does. Artemis is hurrying to pull her boots on. Wade sits up. She turns

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Hey. Artemis. Can you listen to me for one second? and looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These clues, the ones Halliday is leaving? They’re all saying the same thing.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wade...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: He met someone, and he... (a beat) -+. he loved her. And he let it slip away.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wade, you’re embarrassing me.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I know, and I’m embarrassing me too. But I know what I want. I know you feel something. I can feel it.  87. Artemis looks at Wade, very confused.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I just can’t. She hurries out of the room, leaving a distraught Wade behind.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Remember you said if I ever needed help... in the real world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reveal Wade, slipping out one of the windows of the Reb house, backpack over his shoulder, whispering to Aech ove headset.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Course. Just say it. Wade lands on the ground. He heads towards the lights in distance.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Well how far away are you from Columbus? A pause from the other end.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Aech? You there?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m here. Not that far, maybe two hours. I’1ll come get you.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Thanks, dude, you are a true friend.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I know. Just don’t forget that, okay? When you meet me. Aech hangs up, leaving Wade wondering what he meant.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO DRONES have gathered above the Reb Safe House, their lights pulsing softly. A third and a fourth join them. Something is going down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade lingers outside of a fully automated fast food place BURGER CHICKEN-CORN PIZZARITO. There are no workers or co just machines that inject processed protein glop into pre rolled, deep fried burrito shells. Then, AN RV PULLS UP. A mocha colored SunRider, at least decades old. A patchwork of solar cells cover the RV's ro along with a liberal amount of rust. The windows are tint black. The side door opens, revealing a short ASIAN KID who's wa too young to drive. He beckons Wade over.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Shoto? You're a... kid. Shoto laughs.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When did you get here?

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: We flew in yesterday. Aech picked us up. Join the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade climbs in, sees an older Asian male sitting in the b

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: And you must be Daito. DAITO just nods, he doesn’t speak English. Then, from the driver's seat, a voice Wade doesn’t recognize.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi Wade. Wade turns to see a heavyset African American girl, about Wade's age, with short kinky hair.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Hi. Where’s Aech?  89.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I’m Helen. My Dad called me “Aech” and it stuck. Wade is shocked.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Wait, Aech? You?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Ugh. I knew you’d be mad. Grab a seat. Wade barely has time to sit down before Aech peels out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As dawn breaks, the RV rolls into Columbus, the most spectacular city in the world, Paris on the Scioto River.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade now sits in the passenger seat. The tension is palpa

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: So what is it, that I’m a girl? Or Black? Maybe I’m heavy, is that it?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Of course not. It’s just... all those times we talked about girls...

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. Well, I’m a lesbian.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Really? Aech laughs. Now that she’s smiling, he recognizes her.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn, I had no idea.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: You didn’t know? Dude, your gaydar is broken. Aech looks over at Wade.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I wasn’t honest with you.  90.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: It doesn’t matter. I didn’t tell you I was even better looking in the real world. (looking around the RV) I like your set up here.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: We keep it moving. Stay one step ahead. We’re rigged up for five if we need it... She taps what looks like a radar detector on her dash.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Got my 40G wifi hotspot, fully encrypted.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: What happened with Artemis?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: She hasn’t realized that she loves me yet.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: But you love her?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Doesn't matter. We have a key to find.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: That’s the spirit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis walks up to the second floor, looking like she di get a good night’s sleep. She knocks on Wade’s door.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wade? No response. She opens the door. His stuff is gone. And s he.  gl.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (tearing up) Damn it, Wade, I liked you. Then she sees something strange out the window, shadows moving over the front lawn. Pulling herself together, she goes downstairs to check it out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis steps outside, studying the strange shadow patter on the ground. She looks up and sees a weird formation overhead. She squints, realizing too late what it is... THE SKY IS FILLED WITH DRONES, HUNDREDS OF THEM, like BAT CIRCLING OVERHEAD.

dialogues.speaker: THEN
dialogues.text: A HELICOPTER FLIES IN, BLACK SUITED SECURITY GUYS rush th house. Artemis tries to run but is tackled by IOI SECURIT THEN TEN MORE SECURITY GUYS rush into the house, gunfire explosions break the night’s silence. It's an all-out assault.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. AECH’S RV - DAY (THE REAL WORLD) Aech drives while Daito and Shoto are logged in to the Oa keeping up the hunt. It’s Wade’s turn to sleep, but he ke tossing and turning, something on his mind... Finally he bolts upright.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I just figured it out. The crystal door. Wade climbs up to the front seat.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In Anorak's Castle, there's a crystal door.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Dude, there's a thousand Anorak's Castles.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: But I think I know which one.  92. Aech pulls the RV over. EXT. ANORAK’S CASTLE -- PLANET DOOM (OASIS) The Vonnegut emerges in orbit on the dark side of PLANET DOOM. Daito yells in Japanese, Shoto points out the windo

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: Look! Nolan Sorrento has just jumped ahead on the scoreboard.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Sorrento’s got the second key!

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: And I think they’ve beat us to the third challenge... Even miles away from Anorak’s Castle, they can see AN ENORMOUS DOME-LIKE FORCE FIELD surrounding it.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No, you gotta be kidding me. The group deflates.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Screw them.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Screw them. They can’t stop us that easy. I’ve got an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daito is now in the driver’s seat, Shoto in the passenger seat translating into Japanese.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (zipping up his haptic suit) Tell him to drive in the middle lane, safely and slowly. Shoto translates, Daito nods. Aech gets in her haptic rig They log in: READY PLAYER ONE?  93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento, in his office in the Oasis, receives an update through a vidfeed window in his HUD. Number Six stands in front of ANORAK'S CASTLE, INSIDE the force field.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: The intel you got from the raid was good, the challenge is in there. It’s not easy. But the perimeter’s secure, we've got time to figure it out.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: I’m on my way. Don’t do anything until I get there. I want to be the one to walk through the gate.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Yeah, I figured. Sorrento closes the vidfeed window and exits...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento leaves his office, heading for the executive transport platform in the IOI courtyard. As he walks past gravity-defying fountain, someone steps in his way. It’s a bad-ass looking Samurai. Despite a face mask, we recognize him as SHOTO. Sorrento tries to step around him but Shoto blocks him.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of my way! Do you know who I am?

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: Nolan Sorrento, I send greetings from Wade Watts and the First Five.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Are you serious? Security! Before Sorrento can get the word out, SHOTO ZAPS SORRENTO WITH a CATTLE PROD. His avatar crumbles to the ground. INT. SORRENTO’S HOME -- THE REAL WORLD Nolan Sorrento’s eyes suddenly jolt open. That actually h He looks around.  94. He’s in his Haptic Hamster Ball, in the same room we saw during the virtual tour of his home. He breathes a sigh o relief, the Oasis is so real sometimes... Relieved, he pulls off his visor, then hits a button, whi rotates him until he is standing. The hamster ball separa revealing... WADE WATTS, in the flesh, standing right in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Hello Nolan. Wade is pointing a gun at him. Sorrento goes pale.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: No, it’s not possible. Sorrento climbs out, catching a glimpse of his own reflec in the polished walls of the rig. It’s real world Sorrent all right.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How did you get into my home?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Without killing anyone. So far. SHOTO steps out, dressed in civilian clothes, but holding SWORD and a TASER. Despite his age, the look in his eye i deadly.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If you want to keep it that way, you're gonna tell us everything you know about the third challenge and how to pull down that force field. Off Sorrento, terrified...

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. SORRENTO’S HOME - LATER The door to Sorrento’s Haptic Rig Room opens up, and Wade emerges.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (back into the room) Shoto, if his info is bad, start taking fingers.  95. We can hear Sorrento’s protests as Wade shuts the door be him. He walks away from the room, and now we reveal... That this “room” is actually a virtual set inside of AECH OASIS WORKSHOP. Wade walks over to AECH, who sits at a control board which has fifteen camera views of the actio

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: He totally bought it. Wade hands Aech a DATA PACKET (remember they are in the Oasis) and specs for the IOI force field come up in his H

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Course he did. He’s in full haptic feedback, he can’t tell where he is.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: You hear back from Arty? Aech shakes his head “no”, Wade nods.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great job on the skins, by the way.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Yeah, missed a spot or two. Aech points on one of the monitors. THE BACK OF SORRENTO’ HEAD is unfinished.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Can’t look at the back of your own head, right? I wouldn’t worry about it. Suddenly, there’s an earthquake-like JOLT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAITO, driving as carefully as he can, has just driven ov huge pothole, but only because he’s trying to lose...

dialogues.speaker: THREE IOI DRONES
dialogues.text: It’s not clear if they are simply sweeping over or actual tailing them, but Daito is taking no chances. He swerves again.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: What the hell?  96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WADE speaks through his HUD to DAITO.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Slow and steady, D. Daito lets out a stream of Japanese, the only recognizabl words are “IOI Drones”.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Semi-bad news. Wade turns back to Aech, who has finished analyzing the I force field.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Force Field is from a spell in Gauntlet 2027, Magic and Physics proof. We can un-cast it, but only if we’re in close proximity.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: So we go to the castle and un-cast.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we better hustle. Aech refers to another monitor, a live feed from a gunter clan... OUTSIDE IOI HQ -- the SIXER ARMY is preparing for transpo to Planet Doom. THOUSANDS OF THEM.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Okay, let’s wrap this up. They turn back to the feed of Sorrento. To their surprise Shoto not only has his sword to his throat, he is angrily interrogating him.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: If you’re lying, I cut off your hands.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: I’m not, don’t! They didn’t kill her, she’s still alive! Wade suddenly looks up.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: What did he say?  97.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: The girl, Artemis. We didn’t kill her in the raid. We have her! Wade and Aech exchange a look. INT. SORRENTO’S FAKE DECK Wade storms into the room and grabs Sorrento by the colla

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Where is she?

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: IOI, with the other Sixers! She’s fine, a little bruised but... WADE goes for Sorrento and Shoto has to hold him back.

dialogues.speaker: SHOTO
dialogues.text: (under his breath) Chill, Wade. You'll wake him up. Wade turns away from Sorrento, whispers to Aech.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Tell Daito to head for IOI HQ, in the RW. Now.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: On it. EXT. AECH’S RV - DRIVING But DAITO has his own issues. More DRONES close in overhe Daito has to drive into a tunnel to evade them. An IOI dr EXPLODES as it hits the tunnel strut. But as the van pass into the tunnel, the SIGNAL weakens... INT. SORRENTO’S FAKE RIG ROOM The loss of the signal causes the room to PIXELATE, just a moment. Sorrento catches it.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: What was that? Sorrento looks at his reflection again, and this time not something strange about the back of his head. He tries to contort himself so he can see it, but it’s not easy.  98. Another BUMP, another GLITCH... Sorrento’s eyes narrow. He knows what’s going on.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You slimy little bastard. Guess what, I am gonna hurt your little girlfriend. Suddenly Sorrento starts pulling at wires that don’t seem be there and... he DISAPPEARS!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The real Sorrento wakes up in his actual home, in his rea rig, his high-impact haptic skull piece no longer attache He carefully opens his hamster ball... There’s no one there. Furious, Sorrento scrambles out of his unit for real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aech drives as fast as she can in the direction of IOI headquarters, which is visible, not that far away.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Go faster!

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Going as fast as I can. This isn’t my spinner. It’s true, compared to the Oasis, driving in the real wor is painfully slow.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can I just make a point here?

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: The Sixers are at the castle on Doom, but they won’t take the key without Sorrento. So we have a short window to get out there... Wade shakes his head.  99.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I’m going after Artemis.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: But Wade... think this through.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I love her, Aech. Aech sighs, she understands.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: I get it, but breaking into IOI in the Oasis isn’t the same as doing it in real life... oh, crap! Suddenly, Aech swerves...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aech’s RV has been cut off by a TESLA LIMO-BUS, the kind in the future take to prom. Aech immediately throws the van in reverse... BUT A SECOND TESLA, an electricity-guzzling SEDAN, has th blocked off.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Dude. We’re f-ed.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: We gotta run for it. Before they can go for the door, a FIGURE steps out into street, calls to them.

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Aech! Don’t be a moron! Get out of your car! Wade looks at Aech.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Who is that?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: It’s not Sorrento.

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: All of you, stop juggling your nads and get out here, time is ticking ticking into the future.  100.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They four of them tentatively exit the van and walk towar the figure, slowly.

dialogues.speaker: FIGURE
dialogues.text: Can you please walk faster? Before all the bad things happen?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Ven? The voice is the same, but it doesn’t look like David Cro And yet that is unmistakably the inflections of the Vendo who is now revealed to be... OGDEN MORROW.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ogden leads them into the back of the giant Tesla party- mobile.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: (to the driver) Take us to the back entrance of Iol. The driver pulls out as Morrow rummages through a bag of stuff.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m impressed with you guys. Particularly you, Wade, you really picked up on Halliday’s message very quickly.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: One thing I still don’t understand, who was the girl, and why Bethesda fountain? Morrow smiles wistfully.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: Her name was Kira. And she was my wife. And Bethesda Fountain, that was the last place I ever saw Halliday. Off the four, still not understanding...  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Halliday and Morrow argue in the real Central Park, circa 2017.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: You have to let it go, Jim. Do you understand how insane this is?

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: I don’t have to do anything. You stole her from me.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: Stole? Kira and I are getting married. You went on one date with her, fifteen years ago. Halliday is clearly not thinking straight.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: She was the one. The only one. And you betrayed me. You’re OUT! Morrow has tears in his eyes. Halliday walks away, leavin stunned Morrow alone at the fountain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morrow is emotional recalling the moment.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: After Kira died -- and then he got sick too -- he sent me a letter. Very unlike him. It only had two words on the page. “I’m sorry.”

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: (tearing up) Damn. Now I’m getting emotional.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: This contest is his confessional. He wants someone to fix the mistakes he made. Or simply not make them again. The Limo Van comes to a halt.  102.

dialogues.speaker: MORROW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: As a major shareholder, I’m not supposed to interfere, but that luckbox kidnapped your lady, and that is not cool. Here... He hands Wade and Aech ID CARDS. For IOI.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: How’d you get these?

dialogues.speaker: MORROW
dialogues.text: I’m super, super obscenely rich. I can get anything I want. (then) Now go. Save your girl. And the Oasis. The four of them jump out of the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento, in his own car, is moments away from IOI HQ.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Have my rig ready. After I talk to the girl, I’m going in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade and Aech use their ID CARDS to enter IOI HQ. They ac casual, careful not to raise suspicion from IOI security.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: I'll head up to the Sixer floor. You hit the computers?

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Got it. They split off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento pulls into the executive lot. He literally throw his keys at the valet parking guy.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis is on a VIRTUAL CHAIN GANG, helping to fortify IO defenses around Castle Anorak. She drags her feet, a Supervisor glares at her, but then suddenly, she sees the OUT SCREEN...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis emerges from the Oasis to see WADE standing over rig.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wade? Oh my God, Wade, you came for me! She embraces him, then he KISSES HER.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Come on, we need to move. He pulls her out of the rig.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade leads Artemis by the hand across the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Wait, the exit is over here.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: We're not leaving, we’re logging in. Artemis looks at him, surprised.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No one’s beaten the third challenge yet. You were the one who convinced me. This needs to be done.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Well then we're doing it together. But where...

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: The one place they won’t think to look, and where they won’t find us if they do. Wade leads her to the adjacent IOI LOYALTY CENTER.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento enters the Sixer department, only to see one of befuddled functionaries standing next to the rig Artemis just in.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: No. You're kidding me.

dialogues.speaker: SIXER
dialogues.text: She was in here...

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: I thought you had her tethered?

dialogues.speaker: SIXER
dialogues.text: We did, sir.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Well find her! DAMN YOU, FIND HER! The Sixer runs off, frightened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wade and Artemis run through the rows of hundreds of hapt decks, looking for one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: (into comms) Talk to me, Aech.

dialogues.speaker: AECH, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s in the seventh row... exactly eleven units from the end! With Aech’s directions, Wade quickly locates the rig. The swing it open, revealing...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: LaJeremy! It's LaJeremy, Artemis’s NEIGHBOR WITH THE MOHAWK. Wade undoes his restraints.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: Your debt is officially paid off.

dialogues.speaker: LAJEREMY
dialogues.text: Thank you Artemis! You too... dude. He bolts out of there. Artemis gets in. Wade climbs in to next deck.  105.

dialogues.speaker: WADE
dialogues.text: First to the key...

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: First to the egg!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento paces up and down the rows of the Sixer departme urging his troops on.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Come on, people, first one to get to the final screen gets a bonus. I’m counting on you. A SIXER approaches.

dialogues.speaker: SIXER
dialogues.text: Sir, we have reason to believe Artemis is still on the premises.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: SIXER
dialogues.text: I don’t know, but she’s in the Oasis right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Indeed she is in the Oasis, flying the Vonnegut to Planet Doom, while Parzival streams out a message.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Fellow Gunters, today the assclowns at IOI found the third challenge and they put a FORCE FIELD around it. They think we are too busy fighting each other to notice. Nolan Sorrento thinks the gamers in the Oasis will never pull it together. Parzival pauses for dramatic effect.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well I say, tell that to the gunter clans in the gold mines of Ludus. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell it to the anons and the channers, the newbs in the Reddit Army and the 98th level ninja magic users... As Parzival speaks, we see his message broadcast...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On every billboard, on every blimp, on every screen, in e heads up display... all over Incipio, Avatars stop what they’re doing to watch Parzival’s message on their live stream.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Tell it to themed Gunter clans, the Dothraki Klingon Alliance, the Trekkies, the 8 Bit Warriors from the Atari system, the stat-heads from the Fantasy Sports guild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we focus on individuals in the real world; a portly k sweating it out in his cheap haptic rig; a cute cheerlead type in a glossy pink immersion unit; a LAN party of 12-y old pimple-faced geeks in the stacks of Memphis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the hills of a civil war reenactment, Union and Confederate soldiers stand side by side, looking up at th message in the sky.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: I am Parzival of the first five, in the name of Artemis and Aech and Daito and Shoto, we call on all gunters!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Avatars watch Parzival making his declaration on the jumbotron in Times Square...

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Join us in glory! Meet us on the dark side of Planet Doom! In the name of Halliday himself, fight for the future of the Oasis!  107. A BATTLE CRY rises up from a million souls. SHIPS launch ORBIT. Transport platforms are overrun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento watches from the Sixer division, growing increasingly frustrated as none of his Sixers have gotten close to the final key. He gets a message from Number Six.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX, (0.S)
dialogues.text: Hey, Sorrento, looks like we’ve got company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number Six stands outside the Castle. Sorrento appears in vidfeed window, watching with him. They peer into the distance. PARZIVAL stands atop the highest point of Anorak's Fence, holding a BOOMBOX above his head. We hear the first few strains of high-pitched guitar...

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: First to the key, first to the egg! And now the fiery earwig of death that is BLACKENED by Metallica thunders out into the air. And an ARMY OF GUNTE rushes past Parzival and down towards the castle, all of chanting...

dialogues.speaker: GUNTERS
dialogues.text: First to the key, first to the egg! A SQUADRON OF FLYING VEHICLES scream across the sky.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE HILLTOP --
dialogues.text: Artemis swerves up in the DeLorean. Parzival jumps in, an off they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number Six notices that Sorrento has disappeared from his HUD. He turns to look back at the Horde.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: They’1l never get through the force field.  108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Vonnegut, Shoto at the helm, flies over the top of th Castle. DAITO leaps out from the belly of the ship and fa towards the force field. Just as he’s about to hit, he ut the magic incantation of undoing...

dialogues.speaker: DAITO
dialogues.text: RayKassarRassakYar! +. and the spell is un-cast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento zaps in on the transport platform and walks over Number Six, just as the FORCE FIELD SUDDENLY VANISHES.

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: What the hell? Sorrento, armoring up, yells an order to his troops.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Sixer Army, do not let them through the castle walls! Attack! The Sixer Army races out to meet the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An overhead shot of the two massive armies racing towards each other.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Geeks the world over would sing songs of that day. The day the citizens of the Oasis rose up with a mighty fist and collectively rammed it up IOI’s hairy sphincter. To the metaphorical elbow. Within the GUNTER HORDE we find the DELOREAN, weaving pas all manner of avatar and vehicle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DeLorean bounces across the rocky field, plowing thro and around Sixers and their allies. Parzival opens his gu wing door and leans out, steering with one hand.  109.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Sniper rifle! A SNIPER RIFLE suddenly appears in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They say I drove and sniped at the same time. I don't know that it's ever been done before, maybe I had auto-aim on, but I know that bodies fell by my hand. The armies grow closer and closer. Parzival pops off a sh that blows up a Sixer jeep.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The sweat of a hundred thousand nerds poured forth that day. It was violent and aggressive and slightly NSFW. And now the armies MEET! It’s an insane fight, every kind Avatar one can imagine, as if Peter Jackson staged a batt with cosplayers from Comicon.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: They sent trolls... Huge TROLLS stomp across the battlefield, one of them abo to STOMP on the DeLorean...

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ... And we countered with Giants. ++. until an enormous robotic hand reaches down, grabs th troll and FLINGS IT ACROSS THE VALLEY. It’s the IRON GIANT, driven by Aech.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aech is steering the Iron Giant from his customized cockp

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: Eat giant metal, bitches!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Artemis takes over behind the wheel as Parzival fires off more sniper shots. He runs out of ammo and tosses the gun  110.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: More weapons!

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Staff of piercing? Artemis tosses him a DATA PACKET that becomes a long SPEA his hand.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Staff of piercing! He throws it, skewering eleven Sixers at once.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Nuchakus of destiny! They appear in Parzival’s hand and he smacks a disgusting with them, literally knocking it into next week.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Bow of ending! Parzival fires a destructive arrow, and now OTHER GUNTERS into the action, offering their own inventory to Parzival repeats the names of each as he uses them.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Anti-personnel ordinance cannon! Rail Gun! Axe gun! A gun that fires AXES. Silly, but effective.

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER
dialogues.text: Velociraptor! Parzival throws a full grown dinosaur at a group of Sixer

dialogues.speaker: GUNTER 2
dialogues.text: Grenade disguised as a kitten! Parzival, a bit surprised, looks down at the cute kitten in his hand. He shrugs and throws it. IN THE FIELD -- A group of sixers look down at the cute widdle kitty... she purrs and then EXPLODES, incinerating them.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: (solemnly) Musket of Infinite Velocity.  111. A MUSKET, courtesy of Aech, appears in Parzival’s hand. H fires it and A MUSKET BALL smashes through a SIXER, then continues and LITERALLY CIRCLES THE PLANET before smashin into the next sixer, and the next one...

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sixer blood ran safe-for-teen green in the rivers of Planet Doom, in the shadow of Anorak’s lair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento, starting to get nervous, sees that the tide is turning. He pages through his HUD, looking for the right weapon. EXT. ANORAK’S CASTLE Shoto and Daito are at the front lines, expertly cutting trolls and IOI soldiers with their samurai swords, trying clear the one bridge into the castle when... They come face to face with a SAURON/SMAUG/VOLDEMORT mash Forty feet tall, one huge EYE staring down at them menacingly. Shoto and Daito brandish their swords and face off with t creature, realizing... it’s SORRENTO. Sorrento makes short work of Daito, though Shoto manages hack off one of his hands. Then AECH steps in as the IRON GIANT. He SQUASHES SORRENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento, infuriated, finds himself logged out of his rig rushes to get out of the rig and take another Sixer’s spo when he is approached by IOI Security.

dialogues.speaker: IOI SECURITY
dialogues.text: Sir, we've found them. They’re in the loyalty center. Sorrento follows the guards. EXT. ANORAK’S CASTLE Artemis, driving now, steers away from the main gate wher the battle is still being pitched.  112.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: All the other bridges are destroyed, we need to go through the main gate.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: Too many obstacles. She heads for one of the shattered side bridges. It has collapsed into the water, but part of it sticks up, almos like... A RAMP.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Could just be a glitch.

dialogues.speaker: ARTEMIS
dialogues.text: C'mon Z, what have we learned? There are no glitches. Halliday put it there for a reason. The DeLorean roars up the collapsed bridge, hits the ramp part, and TAKES OFF... Jumping the moat the same way Artemis once jumped the cem truck... and landing right in front of the castle, crushi some Sixers in the process. Artemis and Parzival prepare to enter the Castle when suddenly... THE IRON GIANT reaches down and deposits Aech next to the A moment later Shoto and Daito drop in. The five of them enter the Castle. INT. ANORAK’S CASTLE As our team wanders down a cobblestone corridor, they can hear a SIXER struggling with the challenge.

dialogues.speaker: SIXER, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No. NO! Tentatively the Five step inside the Castle’s cavernous G Hall to find... The final challenge is deceivingly simple. It’s a stand u arcade cabinet of DONKEY KONG. The stressed-out Sixer makes a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: SIXER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Crap! These effing barrels!  113. And POOF, he disappears. Clearly you get one shot at the challenge, then you have to start over another day. Parzival turns to look at the troops.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Everyone ready for some Donkey Kong?

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Not so fast. They turn to see NUMBER SIX waiting for them, holding a briefcase.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Name’s Number Six.

dialogues.speaker: AECH
dialogues.text: What’cha got there, paperwork?

dialogues.speaker: NUMBER SIX
dialogues.text: Briefcase nuke. Sorry bucko, but a job’s a job. Number Six hits a button on the handle...

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: A sound like the entire universe cracking in half.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When your avatar gets killed, your point of view shifts into third- person, giving you an out-of-body replay of your final moment. WADE’S POV -- An INCINERATING WHITE LIGHT fills the world accompanied by an earsplitting wall of sound. A blast disintegrates everything, all the Gunters and Six outside, all the dragons and robots and bunnies. Even the First Five are incinerated, to a fine, atomized dust, suspended in the air for a moment before slowly settling earth.  114.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I waited for the inevitable, final message to appear in my display, the words I knew every other avatar in the sector must be seeing at this very moment. ANORAK'S CASTLE remains standing, and the Donkey Kong arc cabinet is still there. Otherwise, the place is empty.

dialogues.speaker: GAME OVER.
dialogues.text: But instead, a different message appears: Congratulations! You have an extra life! Parzival’s avatar reappears, fading back into existence r where he'd died a few seconds earlier.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: In the history of the OASIS, there was no record of any avatar ever acquiring an extra life. He looks down to see that everything he'd been carrying i gone, and his avatar now wears a black T-shirt and blue jeans, the default outfit on every newly created avatar.

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Hello? Can anyone hear me? Silence. He reaches in his pocket, pulls out... THE QUARTER. Only now do we realize that it is made of th same high-definition material as the keys, it is a specia gleaming quarter.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Morrow had given me the most powerful weapon in all of the Oasis. Parzival walks up to the Donkey Kong cabinet. He drops th quarter in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento and his Security team race into the Loyalty Cent bullpen. Sorrento taps a screen, bringing up a GUIDE to w in which rig. ON THE SCREEN -- Every rig has the same name, NOLAN SORRE  115.

dialogues.speaker: SORRENTO
dialogues.text: Let's go, rig by rig, start checking! The team spreads out through the room, opening one rig af another, searching for Wade and Artemis. INT. ANORAK’S CASTLE (OASIS) Parzival calmly progresses through a game of Donkey Kong.

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I could tell you it was the most epic game of Donkey Kong I'd ever played... We time lapse Parzival playing a really long game of Donk Kong, INTERCUT with Sorrento and his men opening rig afte rig...

dialogues.speaker: WADE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: But it was actually easier than I expected. Halliday’s score wasn't that great. Parzival finishes a level, his score overtakes Halliday’s Donkey Kong FALLS off the scaffold, and in the process le go of what he was holding. No, not the Princess...

dialogues.speaker: THE CRYSTAL KEY
dialogues.text: It leaps off the screen and appears in front of Parzival. snatches it out of the air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorrento is starting to lose hope that he will find them, room is so big, there are so many rigs to check... INT. ANORAK’S CASTLE (OASIS) Parzival approaches the legendary UNOPENABLE CRYSTAL GATE is famed for its lack of a keyhole, but today it has THRE keyholes. Parzival takes out the Copper Key and places it into the first key hole. Then he puts the jade key in the second, and the crystal key in the third. He turns the th keys one by one, then... THE CRYSTAL GATE OPENS, leading into a spinning whirlpool stars. Parzival steps through the gate...  116. INT. ANORAK’S CASTLE - STUDY (OASIS) And into Anorak's study. Towering shelves line the room, filled with ancient scrolls and dusty spellbooks. And floating in the center of the room... The egg. Parzival stares at it, a large white oval with pixelated edges. He gently takes it in his hands, in awe. Directly beneath a black dragon painting, on an ornate crystal pedestal, sits a gold chalice, encrusted with tin jewels. Its diameter matches that of Parzival’s silver eg Parzival places the egg in the chalice. It fits perfectly In the distance, a fanfare of TRUMPETS grows, and the egg begins to glow.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You win. Parzival turns to see ANORAK standing right behind him. H obsidian black robes seem to pull the sunlight out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: ANORAK
dialogues.text: The game is over. It's time for you to receive your prize. Anorak holds out a long-fingered hand. Parzival hesitates then he takes it. Cascading bolts of blue lightning erupt in the space betw them, their spiderweb tines enveloping them both. When the lightning subsides, Anorak is no longer dressed his black wizard's robes. In fact, he no longer looks lik Anorak at all. He’s James Halliday. Pale, middle-aged, dressed in his Sp Invaders T-shirt. When Parzival looks down at his own avatar, he sees HE is wearing Anorak's robes. The icons and readouts around the edge of his HUD now show his stats all completely maxed o He now has a list of spells, inherent powers, and magic i that seem to scroll on forever. And his credit readout now displays a number twelve digit long.  117.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Parzival. Your avatar is immortal and all- powerful. Whatever you want, all you have to do is wish for it. Pretty sweet, right?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Super sweet. Halliday leans toward Parzival and lowers his voice.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
dialogues.text: So you ready to run this place?

dialogues.speaker: PARZIVAL
dialogues.text: Actually, I’m going to split it with my friends.

dialogues.speaker: HALLIDAY
